YJAPeMvsxU8yx9UQgMBMqg.text: I really like the variety, ingenuity and quality of the food served here.  The atmosphere comes from the same source.  What I don't like is that when I order my mixed drink the bartender pours light, as in, he doesn't fill the jigger.  If you don't have the skill to free-pour (use no jigger) then at least fill the jigger....otherwise, you're cheating the customers.

cQqP_EFOYjscU9TXhMH1lA.text: When I went there, not sure if it was because it was newly opened or what happened, but it was a bit on the dirty side. There were tables that weren't being cleaned up in a timely manner. It was a bit unorganized as far as the ordering process, counter vs at the table. Will not be coming back, would not recommend it to a friend. The old Gallo Blanco was better!

pJrjNUfvs8LbH-jwUV86Hw.text: After being crushed when the old location closed, my wife and I were excited to try this place.   The new location is odd. While close to downtown (and technically probably considered downtown), it's in the middle of a quiet residential neighborhood. Which I guess is fine, just strange. The space itself is nice,(if not a little hipsterish) and street parking was easy. I'm not sure if they have a lot themselves.  They have switched to an order at the counter, get a number system, as opposed to full service. Which generally I don't mind, but it doesn't seem to work well the way they have it setup. Just one register was open, and we had 2 people in front of us. The register person has to take their order and get any non-alcoholic drinks they ask for. This takes a while. I would say we were waiting for over 5-10 minutes just behind a couple of people. It must be much worse when they are busy.   The menu is similar to the old one, but as several other reviews have mentioned it is almost all in Spanish. Which is usually fine, but there were menu items that had a sentence or two description all in Spanish. This holds up the line even further due to people having to ask so many questions.  Eventually we were able to order. This is not a cheap place. We got 6 tacos, chips and guac, and 2 beers, and with a 15% tip (reminder, no full service) it was over $50. The old location had a killer happy hour, but I saw nothing posted about one here. Maybe they will work it in eventually.   At this point, you maybe thinking, how did this get 4 stars? Well....the food is just absolutely delicious. The tacos are very simple, but the quality of the ingredients is superb. I ate 3 tacos, and probably could of eaten 3 more.   Anyways, to sum up, the food is great, but the prices and ordering system leave something to be desired. And would love to see a happy hour make a return.

AAMz6sEcCCA0bxqQgHE-tg.text: Cool little spot on Roosevelt. Had the vegetable hash at recommendation of bartender ,one of best breakfast dishes I've ever had. Hand squeeze grapefruit juice makes for a fantastic Greyhound as well.

CENkVZmhmfTEPWe6HzRGBA.text: This place is adorable! The food was great and the fact that we walked in with kids didn't seem to bother anyone. Super plus that KIDS EAT FREE!

SFIm1g2GQghaj7yyLYyOkA.text: We experienced the worst customer service at this place. To begin we asked for straws and they never arrived. Then we ordered our food and my food came but my girlfriends didn't. While waiting for her food, my food got cold and soggy. Still another 10 min and her food didn't arrive. Once it arrived the omelette wasn't not great at all. Nice place. Very bad experience.

9F-LIDe-QHNeJK35z9jNZw.text: From start to finish, this lil gem will tantalize every taste bud and immerse you in the downtown vibes of the historic district. You get two salsa choices for your chips, one mild and the other close to inferno, and a beer selection that pairs perfectly. I recommend the torta, family style tacos, and the tried n True classic bean burrito. Don't be fooled by its quaint disposition, this place packs a flavor punch and will not be soon forgotten by anybody who gets a taste.

IYUDiO5Urbq1-tlBPe22iw.text: Funky Mexican food restaurant near downtown. They do not take reservations. Service is counter service order and they give you a number take it to your table. They bring the food to your table.They do have outside seating which is comfortable and plentiful. Everyone was nice, and because we had a party of 8 with 2 toddlers , Once they put together some tables for all of us, we did get table service. Food was authentic. Menus are in Spanish, but the employees will explain it to you if you don't understand. Kids eat free, and can order 2 things off the menu such as tortillas, rice or beans etc. Highchair available.

-A2RP0-SCnnzOW7QVgH34g.text: Love this hidden gem!!! All the food is amazing and authentic. Don't forget to leave room for the fresh baked churros with three dipping sauces Hint..tacos deals during happy hour rock!!!

NZzHFGe8FeCKLqLce6qaiQ.text: Came here for Mother's Day and it was great! I had the egg torta and it was delicious! As well as the amazing pancakes!  They also had great service!

myeYQmOG8lIgD3Bc4nDd7g.text: We had the Huarache Campechana for an appetizer - it was really good And quite filling.  I also had the tacos: the carne asada was good, but the al pastor was really good.  The green salsa on the table was mild and Limey - which I really enjoyed.  The red was very flavorful and medium to hot.  We also had Horchata, which was very good.  It was packed so we wound up sitting at the bar.  The service was excellent and the seating and overall environment was comfortable.  A lot of large windows which was nice.  We will definitely be back!

6m1XqzDxH73Mw2FNM30yYg.text: The Al Pastor and Carne Asada was delicious.  It was my first time trying their Arroz Verde.. it was different but very good.  This location is better than the old one.  Most places never make Jamaica good but this place had it well balanced.  The only thing I would complain about is the parking but everything else was so good I can overlook that.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

m63t5YqjUSTdqevbD4BRvw.text: Good food, good prices and a festive atmosphere. Had my first meal on 7/22/17 with friends and it was delicious. The table guacamole with pineapple was delicious along with fresh, warm chips.  The Naco Torta is highly recommended!! Wow....like someone cooked your breakfast on the the grill. Sooooo tastey! THIS PLACE IS FAST CASUAL SO YOU NEED TO ORDER AT THE FRONT COUNTER, THEN SIT AND ENJOY.  No wait staff will take your order.  This is NOT a quiet place to snug a bug with your honey.....its a vibrant, festive bar  that serves great food at reasonable prices. Go now!!

oakFzLp03mm0ksD2KG44qg.text: Hot damn this place is tasty. The chilaquiles were pretty dang outstanding. Excited to come back and try other menu items.   Ambience is nice. Open and spacious, with fast casual on one side and a bar/full service dining on the other side. Perfect for both busy workers and those looking to hang back and chill.

wa9rDzK2ja3gwme8oFTkXQ.text: This was my first time visiting this place. I am in love with it! I had 2 of the La Flaca margarita's...yum! The tacos were off the chain! I had the grilled fish taco and a shrimp one. So flavorful!!!! The service was the absolute best! I forgot my servers name (Monica?...bob haircut with eyebrow ring lol) She was so attentive and so friendly! I will be going back for sure! Thank you Gallo Blanco!

OYPaEqJhL1l-bFe8yKX3yg.text: Great food and good service. The fries with aji were awesome. Carne asada tacos were good. Neat little trendy spot to meet up with friends and where else can you get tacos and pancakes in one place so a great place to go if you have little ones. Would be better if they served a variety of hot sauces to go with the tacos.

Od1NL1yC4g9udEZJMl0xSQ.text: Classiest authentic Mexican food. Food was out on time and quick. Tucked in some side streets downtown.

STQNsYYdbXGnm10iC3-POA.text: Despite a small number of reviews we decided to give it a try. We stopped by before heading to the airport and boy what a way to end the trip! Starting with super friendly host and wait staff, we got there with 10 mins to spare before happy hours are over, but they were so chill about it and didn't rush us to order right away but added that they would make sure we got the happy hours deal. Ceviche was so delicious, fresh with the right amount of spice, first to disappear from the table. Corn on the cob comes with a boy to prepare it at the table, also super yummy - highly recommend. We regret not getting deep-dish guacamole (free refill or something like that) cuz we thought it would be too much food for us, how wrong we were. We tried all the tacos and they were all very good. Margarita was awesome too. What a great value for a wonderful meal.

d5F9dab0jvYp47YULnWU_Q.text: The veggie tacos were so legit. Not just your standard pepper and onion taco. All kinds of goodness in there. The el pastor had so much flavor. The only think keeping it from 5-stars was the chewy carne asada and very slow carry-out service.   The decor is very cool. Great concert posters, excellent artwork and very impressive woodwork art by Janel Garza.  I would totally go back.

wqonalnYaJRjExTMeXuKJA.text: Love it!!  I'm so happy Gallo Blanco is back and better than ever!  This is definitely one of my go to places in Phoenix.  Great food, excellent service...perfect!  This time we had the guacamole, ceviche and the al pastor taco platter.  Of course, we had margaritas as well.  Everything was awesome...wouldn't change a thing.  I can't wait for my next visit to Phoenix and dinner at Gallo Blanco!!

6KdVREnmcUL3D-ip7Ysgqw.text: 3 ladies, Thursday work lunch, 1230.  Waited for 5 minutes for a table to be cleaned off by Jennifer who seated us and was also our waitress.  She needs further training as she was inattentive and then slow once we did get her attention.   The place was VERY warm and super loud.  I do appreciate that it is in an old market and the furnishings/architecture are cool.  Free cookies at the counter was a plus!  We had the chorizo bean dip and chips.  Delicioso!  The chips were fresh and crisp.  We also had the guac. I was intrigued by the addition of oranges but you could not even taste them and the guac was average.  Not bad but nothing to write home about.  The Pozole Rojo got high marks but the diner would have liked more onions.  The salad La De Casa with chicken had a weird "fishy" taste.  The diner also asked for the dressing on the side and it was drenched upon arrival.  She used the term "rancid".  The plus on this was the chicken, grilled, flavorful, plentiful.  Chicken Chilaquiles - more like a stacked enchilada.  The scrambled eggs I requested were a fried egg with the yolk broken.  The green sauce was too thin and vinegary.  I poured off all I could. Side note, it did taste better after sitting overnight.  Both the soup and chilaquiles were served promptly and piping hot. Last displeasure, $3.50 for a glass of tea is outrageous.  More than a Starbucks Trenta!  Overall 2 of the 3 of us would not go back and would not recommend.  Sorry!

6xKGaGXouTONLI-vP--2ug.text: I was first introduced to Gallo Blanco by a recent client and I am so thankful! This place is fantastic. If you're into coffee, I would recommend the Cafe Miel. Every time I've been back, the service was quick.

IMIAykcfIZ_-EfsSbNKF4g.text: This review is for the bar only..... While I definitely want to come back and try the food, I went in for happy hour with a friend to check out the new location and get a drink. It turns out they only have one cocktail on special for happy hour which is a 5$ margarita....not a bad deal. We each got one..... it's standard fare..... Super heavy on the alcohol (I felt it after just the one). The flavor was very boozy and not very limey making it a real sipper (read: hard to drink).   After our one drink, we decided to move on. We paid at the bar using cards. They use square but print receipts from it rather than use the tablet version. Luckily, Square emails the receipt. It turned out that the bartender had accidentally put in my total as the tip (ie put in 7$ for the tip on a 5.50 tab charging me about 12$ total). I probably would never have noticed it if it weren't for square emailing a receipt. The manager was quick to take care of it the next day and refund the money, which I appreciated.   Anyway, take home message is I'd love to go back and try the food (and update this at that time), but their happy hour is lacking in the drinks department. Maybe they will consider doing a blanket discount on specialty cocktails (a dollar or two) which would be much more appealing than one super cheap drink that isn't all that great. Oh, and check your square emails people.

5wwlAZllCk5mWkj9WSXpUg.text: I've been meaning to write this review for over a week now, and after seeing your latest post on Instagram, I thought today was a good day to share some positivity.  My husband and I tried out Gallo Blanco for the first time last week after researching where we could find some of the best tacos in Phoenix. We went with high hopes, and we were not disappointed! I have to say those were the best tacos I've ever had!  The carne asada and barbacoa tacos were my personal favorites. To top it off, it was happy hour so tacos and drinks were incredibly reasonably priced!  Our server, Mara, was very friendly, fast and efficient! We  will definitely be back next time we are in Phoenix

photos.caption: Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos, tacos, tacos

R8Akw-CecRSSXhois4HdSw.text: Yummm! We have been going to Gallo since it was at the Calarden Hotel. As much as I love the new location the old one will always hold a special place in my heart, i mean who doesn't enjoy a nice swim after lunch? When we arrived at Gallo we had a large party of 9 and unfortunately we where greeted with less than a smile. The lady was quite rude and advised us to a high top table, my husband proceeded to tell her that would not work since we had young kids with us. She replied rudely "well it is self seating". We proceeded to make it work by pulling some tables together. From here on out we have a pleasant experience. Our waitress was super sweet and even gave us a pancake to try "on the house".

bc-7gFxkCThxSEaToMuqmA.text: I used to love this spot. Locally sourced ingredients & great tacos. I have even recommended this place to alot people, but unfortunately the past couple of experiences I have had have been horrible. We had a server, the ticket said his name was Mike G, he made us feel extremely unwanted, rushed, & uncomfortable the entire meal. Didn't ask us how our meal was and then laughed in a condescending manner when we turned down dessert. We almost didn't come back just because of him but I decided I wanted some take out from there this Friday (6/28). Guess who took my order? Yep, Mike G again. I almost walked out but didn't because I was hungry. I ordered an Al Pastor burrito (& a Carne Asada for my husband, papas fritas, guac). When I got home & started eating the burrito, I noticed it was extremely chewy. I started looking inside and I pulled out a giant ring of what looked like either fat or intestines. I almost puked. Almost the entire burrito had these disgusting fat/tripe looking things in it & barely any nice chunks of Al Pastor. Needless to say, I didn't finish. The next day, I had to leave work because I started vomitting, this went into the next day. I lost 12 hours of work because of this burrito. Thanks Gallo & Mike G, I will literally never be back & never recommend to anyone again.

VW9u1B4Wq0WEa6kLYBcpuA.text: One of my favorite taco places in Phoenix. I love the salsa here, it actually has spice to it and The chips are fresh! The elote is delicious, as well as the carne asada and veggie tacos. If you're looking for an "elevated" taco experience, this is a good place to go. Is a little pricey, but it is downtown and the food is actually good.

08QGvCLLyUWUzL6mK0Qd3g.text: Ate here for the first time today and am totally kicking myself on why I didn't try it sooner. Easily in my top 5 Phoenix favorited now. Everything was perfect, amazing quality and the service is awesome. The churros are to die for.

umFqJZDKQ15-tnBa4DBwMw.text: Enjoyed the chicken with the mole negro. Service was good and enjoyed eating too many chips and salsa with guacamole.

gU90oC18wy20WSvoiP5LJw.text: The reason that I put 5 stars is because the food is delicious and fresh. This food has the real flavor of Mexican Food, mainly the Tacos al Pastor are delicious, also the Carne Asada Tacos. The taste of everything is extremely good. I have  not dissapointment about this place. It is well located at Phoenix Downtown. Has a outstanding service and the quality and flavor of the food is extraordinary. Really, enjoyed my time there. For me it was a good experience. I'm looking foward to come back.

awZoepJ1oej5DmN7BqmLpg.text: Welcomed with a hug, and left with a bag of delicious food; 2 fish tacos, 1 carne asada taco, and bean and cheese burro (free, kids eat free here). I am Amazed how consistent the service and quality of food is here. Kelly was kind and even gifted us two cups of iced water as we waited.   Looking forward to another visit soon.   Thank you Gallo Blanco Familia!

lZxIjwtHqb1RqSe7VsxRCw.text: The tacos were super delicious and I really enjoyed the elote! I hadn't had elote since Mexico City and the corn here was really delicious and memorable. I wanted more of it. They cut it for you tableside which is satisfying. The horchata was pretty basic but still delicious. Service was a bit slow for a Sunday lunch, but the food quality made up for that.

pfDckGy5hHRVpb1QLXppBA.text: I came to Gallo Blanco for the first time because a co-worker had recommended the place.. we were greeted and seated, we ordered and waited.. we waited over 45mins and still didn't get our food. I asked the employee to just pack everything Togo and even the cashing out part took another 10mins. I get it.. it was lunch time and the kitchen was busy but that should've been planned for.. that was the worst.. I do NOT recommend.

SEYZqU67T6fAE263hTB19w.text: Our waiter recommended the Envuelto, which was unlike any dish we've ever had and we loved it! I also was a huge fan of the ceviche and tres leches. My wife ordered the Picosso cocktail which was a great addition to the spread. Great food and awesome service, with super reasonable prices.

yIW8MShqjdwfPJNG-N5Tog.text: I'm a huge fan of this restaurant! I'm so happy they opened back up in this great new location. On Friday I decided to take my fiance and dad for dinner. As we arrived the place was already packed, but they managed to seat us right away in the back facing the kitchen window. As the waitress came up I decided to order the guacamole, which is my favorite! I donlt think I eat guacamole at any other places, but here. It is so good and they still make it the same with oranges, my fiance and dad were impressed with the great taste. As we ordered our food I got the Pastor torta, my fiance, the Asada torta and my dad the huarache Patron. Everything we order was so good! The torta was a good size and the meat inside was delicious.  I can't wait to go back and try a new dish!. The service is very good and our waitress was very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I&#39;m so glad this place opened back up.

3jgacnRNupwsSK7bcN5mrw.text: Andy, the bar tender is awesome. The Tierra Madre cocktail may be one of the best cocktails I have ever had...mezcal, freshly juiced tumeric, and tamarindo dressed with lime and fresh thyme.  I started with a carne asada taco...on house-made blue corn tortilla...delicious! I also had the elote callejero (Street corn) shaved off the cob...also the best I've ever tasted (ask for lime to go with it).   I was still hungry so I asked Andy which taco he would recommend next and got the Del Mar....lightly battered fried fish with tasty slaw and sauce...also terrific.   The tacos are traditional small ones so two were perfect for me with the elote. I only ate two chips so I probably could have skipped that altogether.  Try this place! I'm in town from Atlanta for the weekend for a workshop. This was a great recommendation by people I met at the Abraham workshop this morning. Their holiday party here will be awesome!

QEJrWGqkIPT2xH_FGFH1XA.text: I love the place! I live in central phoenix for years and I never heard of this place. My friend suggested that we try out a new place. I was alittle sketched out because it was in a neighborhood. There were a lot of people in the restaurant. I never thought this place was so popular. I got a margarita and tacos. It was delicious! My  friend and I enjoyed the atmosphere. I will definitely come back.

sp-gkWa5oSDkNfA0Wj11oA.text: Holy frijoles! Checking out Gallo Blanco was mostly a positive experience. Friendly staff doing their best to keep your drinks full. I wanted to order some simple standard items. Decided on the Carne Asada burrito and Carne Asada Taco. This burrito had such potential with good flavored meat. The downside was the beans which actually ended up drowning out the Carne Asada. Very little meat compared to the amount of beans. Don't get me wrong the beans tasted good. It's just I didn't order a bean burrito looking to taste Carne Asada every once in a while. Next time I would consider the Pork shoulder Pozole. No complementary chips & salsa here folks! Also was not blown away by the sauces available. Step up your game Gallo Blanco if you want five stars!

Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

et7bz9NoiXfmNXtzKTNTPA.text: FINALLY, Gallo Blanco has made its return to Phoenix and to my BELLY!!! I went to Gallo Blanco in the past when it was in the hotel location and I was super stoked when it reopened as its own restaurant. Its in a neighborhood that looks like its slowly being revived by Phoenix. I personally think its awesome. Kinda like your going to mom's house, since its tucked away within a historic homes area. There isn't a ton of parking but on Sunday afternoon we didn't have a problem finding some near the building. The Building itself looks like a old barn, maybe its new... I don't know but it is beautiful and fits the area really well. Walking in it is pretty loud in there, but it didn't bother us too much.   So this time you order your food first, then sit down and they bring it out to you. We ordered a Elote to share, La Charola (chips and salsa and Guac), and I got 3 Carne Asada and1 al Pastor, and 1 campechana.   We found our seats and within maybe 5 minutes the Elote came out it has butter, chile powder, cojita cheese, and mayo. The waitress offered to cut it off the cob and of course we accepted. It was Bomb... It was spot on. I wish I would have gotten my own, but we got a ton of food so I dealt with sharing. Right when we were about to finish, out came la charola... Plenty of chips, 3 kinds of salsa and our favorite the guacamole. The guac had fruit mixed in, we couldn't tell what it was but it was giving it a sweet kick to it.   Finally TACOS!!! The tortillas are still homemade and delicious and soft. All tacos were served simple with diced onion, and cilantro... I mean really a good taco doesn't need crap thrown on it.. The carne asada are always my favorite, but I have to admit... I was shocked when Al Pastor flared up my taste buds with excitement!!! Lastly was the campechana (mix asada, al pastor, and chorizo). I gotta say next time im gonna have a hard time deciding what to get because the campechana was so freaking good!!! There is no way I could rank these. They are each delicious in their own way. Next time ill just have to 2 of each!!   The service and the waitresses were also great and quick, and the restaurant was clean... Don't think about going here... Make it a point to visit!!

Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elote! Cojita cheese, mayo, Chile powder, and butter

HdCT_5Wnv0wLDo8rZEOFBQ.text: Came in on a Thurs and sat in the bar side. Started with some chips salsa and guac. Red salsa was smoky with a spicy at the end when you swallow and the green was tangy from the tomatillos with spicy eight at the beginning. The guac with it's orange slices is an old favorite.  We had the burrito special which was good but we would have preferred the pork be in chunks rather than a whole slice. The veggie taco was decent and the asada had a good grill flavor but a little dry. The ambience was awesome with the big windows and music. The drinks were perfect and will definitely be back to try other items!

hfLvfwA0OeHnyMEkNwRUBQ.text: Love this place!  Super cute inside.  Casual.  Great food.  A bit of slow service, though I believe its due to the number of diners they serve.  Great food and drink, and family friendly too!  Must try in DT PHX!

XtDkmmT5-f3iIwo1cph_Sg.text: Simple and fresh.  The taste of their tacos is spot on.  The way food should taste.  Thank you for bring simplicity of fresh Ingredients with proper preparation and service to Phx area.   They have to one of the better tacos in AZ.  A must try. We will be back to try the margaritas and other items soon.

n6UPSN53HOfgvjdkra1npQ.text: I had to update my review because they changed the way they serve food and now it's perfect. No more going to the counter to order. You may now sit anywhere, and a server will come to you.  I keep coming back for the amazing food, staff and ambiance. I love that they play a variety of music, including Spanish melodies and rock.  When I'm at Gallo Blanco, it feels like home.

xxIUO_llvwdap2pem-nDnw.text: It's finally back! I really loved the vibe when it was located in the Clarendon Hotel, and this is also a really fun location in a historic brick building.  Otro was a good substitution while we waited for Gallo Blanco  to find a new location.  The fish and shrimp tacos were great, but nothing beats the chips and green salsa! It's beyond addictive!

oEM_LeCLSzCgkybGAoEw8g.text: Nothing beats Gallo or it's sister restaurant Otro when it comes to modern Mexican cuisine. It is Phoenix's best kept secret & the best tacos in the world. The rest of the menu is equally good as well as the drinks and the flapjacks which are served all day.

q4QfY6gPsosrG_oLr-rZOQ.text: Why did I not come here sooner?! Holy cow, super cool spot with great food. Casual with great music for ambiance. The decor is consistent throughout with unique art, just a very clean look throughout. Also they keep place very clean. So we tried two appetizers, an entree and dessert. Oh and don't forget the house margaritas. Where to start...... well we received our drinks first, served in a rocks glass which actually looks really nice. Then the chips with guac and salsa sampler came out, amazing! Each salsa was unique with spicy to smokey flavor profiles. The elote and taco Dorado came out together, he even cut the corn for us. The elote is incredible, cheesy, kind of smoky. That taco Dorado though, omg! The taco shell is fried, nuff said. The meat is tender and the cheese, i need that at home. We finished with arguably the best churros I have ever had, fresh made to order. They come with chocolate, sweetened milk and goats milk caramel sauces. We will be back fo sho!

y3xFDEekozEf2_1jD-Pq6A.text: Really liked the vibe and service was outstanding.  The chicharron De Quesa  was our fav... the Barbacoa taco and fish taco was great as well very spicy. The wine pour was generous. We will be back!

O02Vb2EgalEtQV_0P5QT3Q.text: We went for Cinco and had to wait 30 min for a table but when we walked to the bar area, it was still full service. Grabbed a table for the 6 of us and ordered the Happy Hour Margaritas for the group and chips and dip. Fun salsas and guac to try as well. There was tamarind, pico and other spicy flavors.  My hubby and I ordered the elote to share. It was nice of them to ask if they could carve the corn for us, it was pretty charred and not overly cheesy. I ordered the posole rojo which was excellent. A huge bowl served with flour tortillas, my favorite. Could have used an extra lime and more protein but loved it. He ordered the family style tacos where you select 2 different types of protein, al pastor and carnitas. The huge stalks of green onion threw me off bu the tacos were very tasty and plenty of tortillas to share. Everyone else seems to enjoy their meals. First time there and would like to try it again very soon.

8g9ATfkPMIxEfvccl79H3g.text: Finally was able to make it to Gallo Blanco, use to be a frequent customer from the location at the Clarendon Hotel.  The Fresh Guacamole and Chips are to die for and my go to is the Naco Torta.   All the sauces and guacamole are so good and fresh, love the chips with the guacamole.  The marinated beef in the Naco Torta is killer along with bread, fried egg and slices of avocado in the Sandwich.  The new building location is beautiful and so throwback modern, great job.  The surrounding area has potential and is in the middle of older garfield neighborhood, when I was first looking for the restaurant, I thought this has to be wrong, but there it was.  Still one of my favorite places to go and eat. Glad you are back.

QXGKKZLdawXlbFKCjBB8Og.text: It's been almost 2.5 years since the original Gallo Blanco closed at the Clarendon Hotel. Owner Doug Robson promised an eventual return, which took much longer than I had originally expected. But finally, Gallo 2.0 is here, complete with a new location/setup, a slightly modified but mostly similar menu, and a customer base of loyal fans that, based on the crowd on their first Saturday night being open, clearly didn't forget about them. With their borderline frustrating all-Spanish menu and core audience that covers virtually every single hipster cliche to the point where it's almost comical, it's safe to say that not much has changed since 2015.  Originally, you ordered at the counter and the food was then brought out to you. During a recent visit, it appears that this was changed to a more traditional sit-down approach, which I think works must better.   My girlfriend was a huge fan of the original Gallo Blanco tacos, specifically their carne asada. I had only dined there once before they closed and can remember being blown away by their quality. Despite the owner's sister restaurant, Otro Cafe, also offering tacos, she insisted that they were nowhere near the level as what was once served at Gallo. After several visits since first opening, I think I understand what she was talking about.  Everything taco-wise is excellent, including the asada, pastor, and my personal favorite, the campechana. The tacos don't go overboard with additional ingredients and while I have noticed some slight inconsistencies here or there with meat preparation, they're still largely superior to what you'd find at most other places. And suddenly, all my snarky remarks about thick-rimmed glasses, fedoras, and flawlessly dyed man-beards suddenly become irrelevant. When the tacos are this good, who really gives a damn?  Some say this place excels as a torta joint. I finally got around to trying an al pastor, which was fine, although not quite as satisfying as its taco counterpart. However, sometimes I think the most fun at Gallo can be had with their more adventurous items, such as the envuelto, which is a gooey and cheesy al pastor that you fold inside tortillas. Even something like the simple, yet very well done chicharron de queso, which is a pyramid of ultra-crispy cheese, can be strangely satisfying.  Desserts are kind of hit and miss. The banana cream pie is excellent, while the flapjacks are definitely an unexpected surprise, as they come off more like crepes in texture. I'm a big fan. I've only had the churros once, which was a total botch-job. They were undercooked and very doughy to the point where I'm not sure I'd be willing to take a risk on them again.  Overall, despite a few kinks here and there, I anticipate that Gallo's return will be a huge success. With an already established fan-base and tacos that are top of the line in terms of both quality and flavor, I anticipate very good things for this little restaurant in the future.  Highly recommended!

MTVVTTUbh11DDxrVT0OA0g.text: I have been meaning to get over to Gallo Blanco for sometime now but always end up going to their sister restaurant Otro Cafe. So glad we decided to do dinner here last night!  Immediately upon entering Gallo I was really impressed with the space and the vibe. The space itself is just gorgeous, it's much bigger than I imagined it to be. When I initially saw some reviews with pictures posted of the interior and the large food menu posted over a counter I thought this was a restaurant that you ordered at the counter and then took your food and sat down. I wasn't sure if that was an experience I was looking to have. It is in fact a full service restaurant. I was guilty of judging a book by it's cover!   We were greeted by a server who let us know that they were on a 30 minute wait (7:15 ish on a Friday night, which seems about right) but that the bar was open seating and we were welcome to eat in there, grab a drink, or just wait for a table. We decided to wait for a table and we were pleasantly surprised to be sat within about 5 minutes of being there. SCORE!!!  We ordered the Chip and Guac salsa sampler to start with which was awesome. I loved the different salsas that complimented the guac and the chips are always on point! For our main entrees we ordered the chicken enchiladas a couple of carne asada tacos. Everything is so flavorful. I am a huge fan of Otro Cafe especially the flour tortillas which are out of this world AMAZING so I was a little bummed that my tacos weren't wrapped in those heavenly numbers.   The only con's I have to share would be the noise level. With the beautiful construction of the space the noise carries so if you're trying to have a quiet intimate dinner this may not be the place to do that. There is also patio seating which I imagine would be a better option to dine if you're looking for less noise. Parking I can imagine could also be an issue especially as we get into these gorgeous nights that we are so famous for in AZ.   Overall I loved Gallo Blanco's and can't wait to come back and try out some other items on their menu!

Fcu5kahZwWmryrURbI0w9g.text: Great Tacos in Pork and Meat choices but no Chicken which is why the 4 stars only Come on Chicken Tacos are needed. Guacamole with chips was great app. Would come again fun place FYI bar area gets very loud during Happy Hour

We ordered tacos (fish, shrimp, combo and vegetable) which was highly recommended by our server, Kyle and let me tell you, they were delicious!!  Fresh ingredients and perfectly seasoned. oN3EhplMNfy_rZqbMWfBtg.text: Fantastic tacos!  It's a cute little neighborhood place with delicious food, casual and comfortable decor, good music and tasty chips and salsa.  It was taco Tuesday so we ordered tacos as just $2.00 each!!!! I had the el pastor, pork and the carne asada. The carne asada was amazing, but the pork taco was good but a bit too fatty for me.  The chips and guacamole were fantastic as well. The salas on the table were delicious too.  Service was good. Sit on the bar side of the restaurant for full service. 0DMJlUUrFPeK-5slbxd-jg.text: Best chips, salsa and GUAC I ever ate. Tacos were delish. Posole was enormous with a lot of delicious homemade tortillas. Excellent service. I will come here again and again. What a great!

-vE35bfO__dDGpy1PmSPtQ.text: The food is fantastic. The cocktails creative and delicious.  On the other end of the scale is the service! It is either non existent or indifferent! It doesn't matter which is worse., because I, for one, won't be returning!

cvfi6VVJCeqxWkrClLiRVQ.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican style restaurants hidden in Phoenix. The food and the ambiance is very modern and there is a full bar inside. The food is amazing and the service is good. It can get pretty busy around dinner, usually a 10-15 min wait after 6.

MH6IW19i7V6Ry4a1aOAxTQ.text: I live in the area and dine out often. I had been to the previous incarnation at the Clarendon.  I had a group with me which included a local restaurant operator. It won't matter how good the food is if you can not provide any service. We asked four times for one guests order We had to ask if we were to bus our table We sat with plates for almost two hours @ 36 for two and $38 for one person I expect (better)  any service at all  Match your service to your food I will not be back for long time If you do not want to offer service for the guests who sit up front please make them aware of that at the time of purchase. I was embarrassed for my guests.

zU4xwkW7XCgaicqaZG6apA.text: The fish tacos are yummy, hh price $3.50 ea. Flap Jack pancakes are so good those are $8.00 for 2. ktVRnu9I_johAMhrZhFprg.text: Came in here to grab some tacos, and it was overall pretty solid! On happy hour the tacos were only $2.50 ish. The crispy fish taco was my favorite, then the al pastor to follow. I was hoping their carne asada would be similar to Otro's, but it was quite disappointing. Overall, I would definitely come back!

DBnIA5hsL6E8IeH1np7_AQ.text: Amaaazing food. Excellent salsas and the elotes are superb!  Came back twice in one weekend.  Will be back when in Phoenix.  Great decor and atmosphere.  Super friendly staff.

m4fE1_surn_IefykMRQVNw.text: My wife and I had our first date here 5 years ago... we were excited it was re-opening but I am very confused and disappointed with their new operations concept.  The old location had a small bar and a normal full service dining area.  This location bodes a walk up order and sit down area and a bar area which is pretty much the same size.  Gallo Blanco if you are reading this, do your servers or whatever you call them, a favor by making them servers....not order takers.  I don't know how to tip someone who takes my order at the walk up desk.  I also hate this concept that other restaurants like Hop Doddy are using.  As someone who has served I feel bad for the non server servers because I don't know if they actual work off of tips.  The food was great, they charge for chips and salsa, not sure why because I don't believe they used to.    They also took off some food items like your carne asada burrito! WHY?!  I was told this location is only serving corn tortillas... I don't get it, I hope they figure it out.  Used to be our favorite spot.

Hw7fDpBAbnbMZNQBoDjGCg.text: This eatery gets my very rare 5 star rating! Brunch today was just amazing.  Chilaquiles of death. Cajeta flapjacks with banana and candied hazelnuts. Chorizo and eggs excellent. But the best of all...I ordered a carne asada taco just to see if it was legit. And this place met my every expectation. I have yet to find a legitimate street taco in this town. They have it here! Add to that the great craft cocktails and specializing in tequila and mezcal plus the ambiance and transformed kitchen and building. It's not in the best part of town but it adds some sparkle to its surroundings. Try this place out!

yaB2pcSJeJYSthXGyqCymw.text: This is hands down our (hubs and I) favorite brunch spot in Phoenix. We come here often! My favorite is the breakfast burrito and my husband has tried most of the brunch and loves it all...the huevous rancheros being his fav. Also, you can get non breakfast items in the morning as well. A friend thought that was simply amazing. They have the best, seriously the best, Bloody Mary's! You have to try one! Lastly, we have always had great service. The staff is awesome!

CIpxTqc7A1uWHzjQozYydQ.text: I was really hoping I could count on this place to deliver good quality mexican food and service. Quality is ok and service sucks. I ordered a meal that cost $21 and anywhere else like True foods, flower child, or any other health contemporary place to eat would cost $10-12 most. I left eating cold rice and basic tacos with no salsa. I wish I would have went someone else for lunch. The two stars is for the atmosphere in aesthetics of design and the effort but sorry I won't be returning. Wasted $ basically ordinary.

-HkQeTGSK19EJKm7KGxwSw.text: I'm glad that they finally opened. This is in a quiet area of the Garfield district so street parking was not a problem. The exterior mural, patio, abundance of bike racks, and their name glowing in soft blue light from the plasma cut steel door trim at the entrance gave assurance that this would be a welcoming, fun place for dining and having drinks - and as it turned out, that's exactly what it is. The place was hopping busy for the opening night, and the staff was very friendly and alert. Ordering is done at the counter and after you are given a number sign to place on your table, you seat yourself. It was good to see many of the old favorites on their menu, and I ordered the refreshing Gallo margarita and the Ceviche de pescado. The ceviche was divine - very fresh slivers of fish marinated in citrus, with cilantro, basil, cubes of avocado and slices of cucumber, red onion, jalapeno and cherry tomatoes. This initial visit to the establishment's reincarnation was definitely not a disappointment and of course I'm coming back ... For the longest time I've been craving the elote callejera and the amazing tacos that I remember from their old location and now they are available once more!

UZvfThva7NHL9G8ipiHjvg.text: Very happy to be able to return to GB at new location.  We came in on a Sunday night.  Barely anyone in the place. Food was good but the service was very slow.  Took at least 20 minutes to get drinks. Appetizers came out at different times.   I read other reviews about the service and I would agree,  very good food but the service makes me not want to return.

hnapkq4BjL5aW5DUkhv12g.text: I loved the old Gallo Blanco inside the Clarendon Hotel, so was super excited to see them open in a new spot.  Unfortunately, ended up being a complete disappointment.  The new location is really nice, love that they repurposed an old neighborhood supermarket.  For that, I'd give them 4 stars.  But that's the extent of what I found nice about this new location.  The physical set up is confusing as hell.  We are told to check in and then wait for our table, but yet there is no physical space to wait!  We literally had to stand against a wall with diners no more than 2 feet away.  A truly awkward set up.  You're given a table with a # placard on it, you then have to saunter up to a counter to place your order, including drinks.  As you can't sit at the table and casually peruse a menu, this made for a super slow and confusing process.  If you wanted another drink, you had to go back up to the counter to order.  URGGGHHH  After that awful experience, I thought at least I would enjoy our food and drinks.  WRONG.  I loved the food at the old Gallo Blanco and expected the same quality.  My Michelada drink was bad, they literally filled my glass 3/4 with tomato juice, the guacamole was flavorless, the Seafood Cocktail was bland, my salad was soggy with too much dressing and the carne asada tacos were ok, but meat was tough.  I had high expectations and will not be back unless I hear that there is a miraculous turn around.  BTW, you can get full waiter/waitress service if you sit at the bar or in a communal table in the bar area.  If you're on a date night, not a good set up.

1s7En8uHToT3MR7HA-TA7w.text: I remember the old Gallo Blanco, it's not the same of course but their food is still amazing! However, I do miss their shrimp tacos. If your vegetarian or vegan this place is not for you. Their taco options was either fish or vegetable tacos which is okay. I wish they had more options for those that don't eat red meat but hey, that wouldn't Mexican. I like their new location, it's very unique and fits all crowds. I wouldn't go here during first Friday though for I assume this place can get packed due to its location. I give this place four stars only because I really do miss their shrimp tacos.

sr9Ep4nDc28bitGTiryu3A.text: Liked the original location at the Clarendon and love Otro. The location was nice.  Love to see the addition to the Garfield District and what it means for the community.  The asthetics were good.    Didn't like the ordering setup. I know they have full service at the bar, but still.  It took us 30 minutes to get a table. Ordering at the counter was clunky with a few parties ahead of us. Three of us were called up within a few minutes.  Maybe have two people at the counter to take  orders to speed up things?  The food was good, but over priced.  $48 for two beers, some corn (elote), and a taco platter? The elote was $7 for one husk of corn.  We walked away feeling like we didn't get good value.    I applaud the initiative, the location, and the taste, but the logistics will not have us coming back until a change is made.

w43wzd4X7grwPui5TPstFA.text: Now, don't get me wrong,  the food here was fantastic! The carne asada was grilled to perfection, packed with citrus juiciness and cilantro garlic flavor but the wait time was ridiculous.  Arrived at 4pm on a Sunday, there was maybe 12 people max, including a party of 2 on the patio. We had to go inside (15 min later) and get our own menus after being told it was full service. It took another 10 minutes for someone to come out and get our drink order and then about another 30 min for the food to come out. On top of this, there is a rather large fly infestation on the patio. It's too bad that these setbacks exist because the restaurant is in a cute building , nicely designed with cozy garden decor on the patio. A few margaritas should allow you to look past these things, though.  The margarita was exceptional.

Completely delicious, just like you'd want.   They have a really cute patio that's good for smaller groups, and a nice built out bar that is separated some from the rest of the restaurant. Great atmosphere. Love this place!!

Highly recommend the Elote, Civeche, and Family Style Tacos  (and I'm excited to come back and try the rest of the menu). I love that their beans are vegan.   To be honest, the service from every single person we interacted with, from the moment we walked in, to the moment we left was really impressive.   Great experience all around!  We will be back :)

cHXwyotDEa3ByHjeqe59rA.text: Authentic place that we come to every trip to the Southwest. We never wait to get a seat here even on a busy Friday night and there is plentiful free street parking right in front of the restaurant. I had the Al pastor torta and my wife had the naco torta. We shared the chips and guacamole. All were great. We had a promo to use because we joined their newsletter and got the guacamole and chips for free, a $9 value. I got a stiff cocktail that set me back a whole 8 bucks. All in all our meals, plus drinks, were barely more than $30. Try that in Seattle.

People still do walk around to fill your drinks and clear your plates.  Ordered the Cortado Dos salad w/ al pastor which was veryyyy good.

E4t4nEahorNn45_LpqjbYw.text: So this would be my first time visiting this new location that re-opened  almost a year ago to date. Prior we would visit when they were located inside the Clarendon Hotel. It's really convenient now that they have there own stand alone location in downtown Phoenix. We made a visit on a Saturday evening for dinner and were seated right away! You do have your choice with sitting in the bar or dinning area, we chose the dining area for this occasion. Very satisfied to see that the menu has not changed since our other visits years ago. For the appetizer I ordered the "chicharron de queso" with aioli sauce.If you have never been here or have never tried this appetizer please do not hesitate. It's basically fried cheese rolled up nice and crispy on a plate!  The main meal was the traditional carne asada and barbacoa street tacos that came out in a skillet. I have tried many of places when it comes to street tacos or taco shops and this location by far is the best in town hands down! The cocktails were  a 'la paloma" (lime, grapefruit and tequila mix) and a mexican whiskey mix that I cannot remember the name of. To go we ordered both a hot and iced coffee that was amazing. I like my coffee black and i could not believe how strong and flavorful the beans were! According to our server the beans are local from Tucson, AZ.  Overall our server was great and attentive! We love the "chicarron de queso" so much, that we placed an order to go for those late night cravings! Really happy to see Gallo Blanco back and will be making future visits very very soon!

sGC6ibtAyBzuba3TPJKG3A.text: Went for dinner with my wife and three year old. I started with the flacca margarita. Easily one of the best I have ever had. We shared the dip sampler. All three salsas were great. The guacamole was terrific. I had al pastor, carne asada, and barbacoa tacos. Each was awesome. We had churros for dessert. Everything was great.

idC2w5MI7vOi27JnvMBdlw.text: I love this place. Super cute location and atmosphere. Easy (and free) parking around the neighborhood. I have taken a lot of people here and everyone always loves it. We have never gone to a restaurant where the beer was more expensive than the cocktails during hh. It just seemed weird. Everything else was great though. We had the family style tacos with carne and al pastor. Loved the blue corn tortillas and all the meat was flavored really well. Highly recommend this place and their sister restaurant Ottro!

82zNY5HWckhsffTLPoQMCw.text: Went here for the first time over the weekend and it was really good! I mean parking over there was a bit of a turn off at first, but otherwise a good experience. Kind of an odd location but I feel like that's all good places in Phoenix! I like the little cafe counter area up front. The whole restaurant is pretty cute inside!  They have a good amount of vegetarian food, and the vegetarian stuff is labeled which makes my life a little easier. I was kinda hoping to see a vegetarian burrito or something, but the other options were good so not a problem! I got vegetarian pozole which I've never had before. I also got chips and guacamole with salsa! The soup was really good. We did have to ask about the tortillas it was supposed to come with because they weren't brought out, but when they were I was glad we had brought it up! They were amazing tortillas! The guacamole was so good too, as were the salsas. Not incredibly pricey either, I'd totally come back!

1idqY5ySu1aStw7LFWM8Lg.text: Chef Doug Robson is someone well known enough in this town to bear the burden of expectations.  Gallo Blanco was a breakout sensation back in its original location on the bottom floor of the Clarendon Hotel.  It was relatively small, had a hip modern urban feel, and (while limited in its selection) served quality tacos, tortas and other Mexican staples.  It was so successful that Robson later opened another restaurant in CenPho (Otro Cafe).  After an unknown dispute with the hotel owner however, Gallo Blanco abruptly shuttered in 2015.  Gallo Blanco fans rejoiced when Robson decided to reopen his first restaurant on the northeast corner of 10th Street & Pierce.  But would the new location measure up to the original?  On a Sunday at dinner time, I decided to judge for myself.  The new location is in the century old American Way Market building that had long been abandoned.  Robson has meticulously restored the building into a beautiful space which has patio seating on the east and west ends of the building.  The interior is segmented in two, with the restaurant on the north side of the interior and the bar area on the south side.  I grabbed a seat at the bar area as I was here alone for dinner, but also because of the natural lighting of the windows that look out towards Pierce Street.  Just FYI, here you grab a menu at the front counter and then sit wherever you want.  I had neglected to visit Gallo Blanco when the new location first opened, but that quickly changed after sampling a pancake dessert taco at the Devour Culinary Festival that was out of this world.  Having seen that Gallo Blanco does in fact serve a dessert pancake, that was all the motivation I needed to make the one mile walk over here from my apartment.  But first, let's not get ahead of ourselves.  First there must be a drink.  In this case, I ordered GB's house margarita.  Tequila, triple sec, lime, and agave.  I wouldn't say GB's version is really distinctive in any noticeable way, but a refreshing marg nevertheless.  Now then, let's get some dinner.  I've had GB's tortas, tacos, and even a few burritos back at their old location, so for this visit I decided to take a look at their house specials.  One dish I was curious about was their Pescada Del Dia (Fish of the Day).  Today the fish special was Mexican Grouper.  Sold.  The dish also comes with rice and beans, but not just your a-typical rice and beans.  The rice is jasmine rice mixed with corn, tomatillo salsa and cilantro.  The beans are locally sourced beans from McClendon Farms in Goodyear and are topped with a sprinkling of cotija cheese.  The fish was excellent.  Grilled perfectly with a nice flaky savory finish and the rice and beans were both solid accompaniments.  Now then, let's talk about that dessert.  Sadly, the pancake dessert here isn't the same recipe Doug used during the Devour competition (that recipe incorporated horchata ice cream), but their Flapjacks dessert nevertheless looked like a can't miss.  Two full size pancakes topped with butter, maple syrup, whipped cream, banana, and candied peanuts.  I'm a little disappointed that this dish didn't have any Mexican infused notes like their competition dessert did, but the pancakes were certainly tasty despite that fact.  Total cost for the margarita, food, tax, and tip came to $45.  The food, the prices, and the atmosphere are slightly more upscale compared to other valley Mexican restaurants.  I don't mind paying extra if the food measures up.  In the case of GB's current operation I think the food is worth it...mostly.  You can certainly get great quality Mexican food all over town for cheaper than here.  But between the tortas, house specials, and even the sides, there's plenty here at GB that stands out from its competition.  Between Gallo Blanco and Welcome Diner (which is soon to open its new location across the street from Gallo Blanco), the Garfield neighborhood is now on the map in the valley's endlessly expanding restaurant scene.  Props to Doug Robson for saving a landmark in the process of resurrecting his beloved first restaurant.  Now if he'd just resurrect that horchata ice cream dessert recipe, it'll be full steam ahead.

eArAtcH9i0ovnlqR0ymLwg.text: Found Gallo Blanco "by accident" after attending ASU graduation last week at the convention center, 05/08/18. It was several hours after the graduation but we called ahead just to be sure we could get a table. It was mid-afternoon so no problem we were told, by the time we left the restaurant after our meal, the tables around us were filling up with the dinner crowd and it is no surprise why! The atmosphere, the food, the service... all impeccable and so unique. The shrimp 'n grits had a special mexican flair, all three college students we brought with us couldn't say enough about the naco tortas, and even my son who is usually a picky eater devoured the carne asada tacos. Suggested by the server was the cocktail Tierra Madre (mezcal, turmeric, and tamarind), it was unique and a refreshing change from the my "usual" margarita. Chips and delicious salsa, and churros with three sweet dipping options an added bonus. There was so much on the menu we wanted to try, wish we lived closer so we could come back again. Kudos to Doug Robson, we stumbled upon a gem in Phoenix downtown area, a great surprise after a special family day!

EkN4SPQsh7UJkch9SJN_Qg.text: Service and location is excellent. Food was ok. I really miss the old menu and food quality of the old Gallo blanco.

u9PSwyE_yk_F0JKgCEGyvw.text: Chilequiles and coffee! Kids eat free.  The setup is a little confusing but the food and experience is still spot on. So happy to have the White Rooster back in PHX!!! Perfecto

QILtU7LKvEx-zjudOVs0_g.text: Excellent appetizers, drinks and service. The guacamole was amazing! We enjoyed the cooler weather by sitting on the private inside patio. Will definitely make this a regular stop for happy hour.

KfPsQmYV3Xg4-_JjW3ok4g.text: Great happy hour prices. Their Al pastor is a must try as well their elote. Also reasonable prices on drinks when it isn't happy hour.

TY8moDPBrNIC1-03I5B4bg.text: Live in the Garfield District. Own a business on the outskirts of the Garfield District. Drove by the building site for months. Was sooo excited to finally see the restaurant open. I'm within walking distance after all. On August 18th I was there for my second time. The food had been good so far. BUT when I went to take my last sip of wine it was all sediment. The texture of which was a mouthful of dirt or sand. I HAD TO SPIT IT OUT!!! When I pointed it out I was asked if I  drink wine enough so as to expect it!?! Further, the tone and attitude towards me was as if I should have expected it and was stupid for even complaining. I was asked if I thought they did it on purpose! ("What!?! You think I did it on purpose!"). I was given an attitude and disgusted looks from the bartender and the waitress. Then they proceeded to talk about me as if I wasn't even there: "what does she expect a discount?" First, no I did not expect a discount I expected courtesy and service at a restaurant that I had been looking forward to opening for a very long time. Second, does it matter how much wine I have drank in my life to be able to expect NO DREGS in my glass at a restaurant? Is it too much to expect after tipping 25% for a bowl of guacamole, chips and wine and get up to leave, take my last sip and get a mouthful of sediment that maybe I should not be talked down to like I'm expecting too much?? I hate to label places but, after that treatment and the persons who treated me like that - it seems like a total separatist hipster place where if you're not a hipster you get treated like crap. Or you should be expecting to get treated like crap because it is a hipster place. Not sure which one of those is right.  So looked forward to the opening of this place. BOOOOOO!!!

bgITeI-lOSQtGmgwKbTf8w.text: Great food and service nice addition the area. Fan of the old Gallo blanco. Fan of the new Gallo blanco.

cFHcWa3VYRPxrs5MgileaA.text: WORST PLACE EVER!! IF YOU LIKE BEING TREATED LIKE A SECOND CLASS CITIZEN THIS  IS THE PLACE TO GO!!!! Never ever will I make the mistake of giving this mediocre place an opportunity to give them my hard earned money for the worst customer experience.  After waiting thirty minutes for our beverages to be refilled and noticed that everyone that had come in after us was eating,  I asked the server to check on our order. After a few more minutes of seeing her searching the register looking back at us several times she came back with a insincere apology and preceded to explain that the order was not received and asked again for our order.. .. I calmly informed her that we had to leave she became indignant and asked us to wait once again while she brought the manager to speak to us, even before we could leave our seats she ran off to the back of the restaurant and waited for us to exit the place. Not only was the service incompetent but they had the audacity to give us attitude because we  refused to wait and listen to another moron, lol.

No. There are certainly better hole-in-the-wall  Mexican places in Downtown Phoenix for better prices and better food.

1ZZ7_YW5HhASPSp7LYJwuw.text: Great tacos and awesome vibe. It's hard to find but it's worth the trip. This will be a regular taco Tuesday stop for us.

vALukLMWrtxg_rNgP6nXug.text: So disappointed to be writing this review, as the food is good. But, the service is painfully slow! I have been to this restaurant at least 4 times, and each time the place was almost empty or had a handful of patrons. So the service wasn't much of an issue. Well today was a different story! This time they were packed. Which normally I would be happy for a restaurant but this place was beyond ill prepared for this kind of business. Heads-up if you walk in and this place looks busy, walk out find somewhere else!! Not only did it take over 10 minutes for our waitress to come and take our orders, but took even longer for her to actually come back and ask if we wanted out check! We say yes, she leaves for 15min comes back with NO Checks and says she's having a tough time splitting up the checks on the system so asks us for our bills separately by hand! We give our credit cards bill unseen at this point, cause we have been in the restaurant for over 2 hours now!!! Another 20 minutes go by and still no checks!! I finally walk up to the front and someone else is closing our checks out. He apologizes and says "system issues", I told him I could understand that but the waitress said that almost 40 minutes ago. We just want to pay and LEAVE! I won't be going back here again, just not worth it. We used to host an afterwork event here monthly, with so many options in the area we are moving on!

s42krW6wYsEBTrOv_noWQg.text: Chef Doug your place rocks after 5 visits and numerous items we are so glad you reopened Gallo Blanco. I like Otro Cafe but I love Gallo Blanco and you even personally made us Bloody Marys that were easily 1000x better than any others we have had. Ok they were the same but the fact you asked with a little bit of nervousness means you really care and for that we are grateful for your amazing tortas, tacos, posole, and everything else we have tried.

-Buppxc3ury4TxByqSa5Ag.text: Place was open for good late night food and drinks.  Tacos and more tacos. Had the pastor and carne asada.

tTIVifSUMg2QFyHbJpHCMg.text: It was my first time here and if I was honest with my actual opinion of the food I had it would be one star. The waitress was super nice and my friend enjoyed his meal. The Al Pastor burrito was not worth it in my opinion. The manager said it was the normal portions and that no one ever complained about it before in the entire history of the restaurant. I would say after living in Mexico and eating a lot of Mexican cuisine all over the southwest that the Pork missed the mark on taste and texture. There wasn't hardly any meat or beans so it was really difficult to tell but once I searched through the tortilla and found what seems to be seasoned and cut up hot dog, I realized the hipster burrito/Mexican attempt wasn't for me and neither was the passive/ aggressive attitude from the manager. We also had to wait 45 minutes to get food and the place wasn't busy. There are too many good food choices, especially Mexican for me to return. Oh and one more thing if you want any kind of traditional salsa options you won't find it here. I was excited to try this place because of the good ratings but unfortunately my experience was not very good.

WkxAFrZW0blYIYMckZ0SoA.text: Every now and again you taste something that changes your entire perspective on a dish.  Tonight, the campechana taco at the new Gallo Blanco on 9th & Pierce, did just that.  It's blend of al pastor, carne asada, and carnitas demonstrated both a mastery of flavor and texture.  Of the two, flavor is the easier to come by - nearly anyone can follow a clever recipe and achieve positive results.  What separates good from great, then, is texture - which is a product of great technique.  This campechana manages to master both, and the result is incredible.  In a sea of taco purveyors, Gallo manages to rise above - this food is important.  I think we've found the next great Phoenix restaurant.

8BxBMTls-6UJJQgGE62Q4A.text: I walked in and was pleasantly excited but also confused. The texture of the space seemed really cool. There is a separate bar area and a walk up ordering area. Good mix of tables but the two tops seemed a bit small. A little peeved when we walked in because the menu said HH was available, but the staff said it was not. I get that it's still a new place. A sign would be nice. Food was as good as I remembered. I ordered the elote ($7 a little steep). Really flavorful. I also ordered three tacos ($3.25 EA): Al pastor (my fave- great flavors), carne (ehhhh- ok flavor and chewy), and del Mar (good). I also ordered a chelada to wash it down.   Bathrooms were very cool. Modern and hip.  The patio area will be awesome when it gets cooler.  I will be back! Welcome back Gallo Blanco! We've missed you.

V81Ri9GMViE9UuClrt5szQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants downtown/ Central phx. Never been to the old location so can't tell you if it's similar or better. The food is amazing and reminds me of my Nana's cooking growing up. But don't tell her. The tortas have an abundance of meat and the bread they use is amazing. Everyone kept telling me to try their famous chilaquiles and I was not disappointed.

gwrsNfZJutLTLrLofsX2XQ.text: Started out strong, seated quickly and was the only table. 25 minutes later still didn't have our cocktails or appetizer. By the time our food arrived, 1hr 10min later, we had only seen our waitress twice, empty water glasses, and nobody ever came back to check on us. Most of the tacos were dry with no sauce, no salsa, no chips.  No one came back to pick up our check so we eventually had to go up to the front to to pay the bill ourselves.

1VBAA-kk-idGy9trJbuE2g.text: This has got to be my new favorite restaurant in Phoenix...my family has eaten here twice since it opened! I was a fan of the old Gallo Blanco at the Clarendon and, like many others, was highly anticipating its return. Well, my high expectations were exceeded! The food, which is apparently a modern take on authentic Mexico City cuisine, is sublime. Simple ingredient combinations, but oh so fresh and flavorful. The al pastor, in particular, is the best I've ever had. The homemade telera bread on their tortas is epic. Plus, kids eat free!!! The location is super cool, in an up and coming part of the Garfield neighborhood. Love the mix of historic and modern architecture. We'll be eating here regularly!

aaw49aYdBtg-qmlF5Hqgng.text: You know, I love the food. Been going to Gallo since it was in the Clarendon. Visit Otro regularly. You even catered my sons wedding reception. But, please get more help in the bar area. Customer service is C at best. I was the one who walked out tonight. And I live in Garfield. Not ok to wait on others while I wait patiently to be acknowledged. Even told another employee to tell them I had been waiting. Not even eye contact.

nfIol5Q7t0Lnrr-l3iERjQ.text: First impressions are everything. Ambiance was nice until We were greeted by a hostess who either is not properly trained or truly dislikes her job. I'm leaning towards the latter. The drinks tasted good but overpriced for the small servings. We really liked the guacamole however most of the food was bland. There could be potential with the menu if effort was made to season the food with intent for it to be as flavorful as it was designed to be.

izafJzCPfbOvBtOKVL3YDQ.text: This place was cute! service was fast and the food was amazing!! Chips and salsa also amazing! Definitely will be back.

i_XWoyW5K_JlMKfdV0saEA.text: Let me start off by stating the food here is amazing, especially the guacamole. However, the service was absolutely awful. My husband and I started out by ordering drinks which literally took 35 minutes to receive. Once we did receive them, they were watered down. It took this amount of time for the waitress to come back to even take our order. She apologized and said she would "make it right", which of course did not happen. In fact, once she brought the bill we were actually overcharged for items we never ordered. She corrected the bill, but never did anything to rectify the horrible experience.

skjgXXGBtgANqV4qPV_MIQ.text: Never made it to the old Gallo Blanco, but today got to try out their food in the new location in the Garfield District. Service was good, we sat at the bar. The fresh limonada was delicious and refreshing, my son had the jamaica, that too was delicious. He had the chilaquilas, which were so super tasty. I had the Huarachi Camponada, a plate full of flavor and the presentation in itself was beautiful. My husband had the padilla dish which came with a stack of fresh corn tortillas, he was very pleased. We shared the banana cream pie and churros. The pie was creamy, there was fresh banana slices, caramel and peanuts as a garnish on top. Super amazing!!!  The churros were fresh and hot that came with three dipping sauces. This cuisine has a new meaning to Mexican food!  I watched the bartender make several different drinks, that looked different from your ordinary cocktails. So far the best find in the Garfield District!

UI9GM6NeSPRozkwXQsvOvQ.text: We came here on a casual Sunday evening and it was fairly quiet with some people around. Heard the reviews were good and it was close to our hotel so we decided to give it a try. Had the enchiladas and a lager beer and I must say the enchiladas were amazing. Not tasting like the typical Americanized ones I've had before which is usually just loaded with cheese but limited flavor. This tasted like authentic Mexican cuisine similar to the ones I've had in Mexico itself. The chicken, sauce, cheese, and toppings were all perfectly balanced and in tune with what I like. Ambiance inside the place had a Mexican look and vibe as well.   Definitely recommend this place!

TtGOgPsdDIEEGe5OfR-5lA.text: The service was slow (Thursday) and when we let our waiter know that this was our first time here - he didn't seem to want to help guide us in what the best dishes were and seemed annoyed.  The kids cheese quesadilla came out and was blue corn tortilla... at many other restaurants this wild have came out on a standard flour tortilla.   The carne asada Taco also came out on the same blue corn tortilla - wasn't given any other options. The carne asada also had a fishy taste to it.   They charge for chips and salsa. (Half of the chips were burnt)   After the food arrived we were never asked how everything was.   When the check arrived we brought our issues to his attention and he shrugged it off and said well we didn't charge you for it anyways and walked away.

kMvz-50dSLEq1bcEKViZDw.text: My boyfriend and I had an amazing meal at Gallo Blanco last night. Everything we had was on point-the tamarind agua fresca was delicious and not too sweet, and both cocktails I had were very well balanced. We started with the guacamole, which was seasoned well, and then I had the legumbres salad and my boyfriend had the fish torta, both of which were excellent. We ended the meal with probably the best churros I've ever had. Our server was very friendly and knowledgeable and helped to guide us through the menu. We can't wait to come back!

bpmpsjt7SAejVuXc-WzG2A.text: We love this place and it's a "go-to" for us when we have out of town guests.    Thursday we were meeting our Spokane friends there for early dinner, and when I pulled up the place was either undergoing renovation or was being dismantled.  I was stunned.  I looked for a sign that would tell me when they were re-opening but found nothing. I asked the folks in Welcome Diner if they knew what was going on and they simply said "They're closed".  Does anyone know what's going on?  Is Gallo Blanco closed closed? Or temporarily closed?  Such a great place.  It would be a shame to lose this gem.

2fGjskmtCsUfykq39Cjjdg.text: Walked in on a Thursday night about 7:30 and the place wasn't too busy so I questioned what I was walking into. We were seated promptly and offered menus and asked about drinks within a minute or two.   Our server had amazing knowledge of the menu and the preparation of dishes. She also shared her knowledge with enthusiasm which was great to see. My drink selection was fair, the Chelada but others in my party loved theirs. When food started coming I was impressed at each dish. Presentation and flavor was excellent. I ordered the Shrimp and Grits, not a typical item for the menu theme but again a recommendation of or server. It was not at all what I would have expected but in a remarkable manner. Great full flavor and an amazing twist on a typically southern dish.   We will certainly return!

XjaAMIB0aDBaDpp5SM2vbw.text: Omggggggggg. This place is sooooo delicious! Probably the best guacamole I've ever had! It has pieces of orange in it. I know what you're thinking, doesn't sound good but it's so delicious! And the chips are to die for! We also tried the elote, which was good but I've had better.  I got el pastor tacos which were really good and a shrimp taco. I didn't like the shrimp taco. The seasoning of the shrimp was too strong. The horchata was also good. The beans were bombbb! I definitely want to come back for breakfast.

sKHihv_5v4AWqt35cpJZyg.text: I consider myself a food snob, and when it comes to Mexican food, an extreme food snob. I'm a big believer in you-get-what-you-pay-for, and Gallo Blanco delivers, big time! Started with the Chelada, extra spicy, so good. Had the guacamole, it was fresh and perfectly balanced with flavor: lime, tomato, onion, cilantro. I read an earlier review about wanting to lick the bowl so I ordered it. I was not disappointed and I did want to lick the bowl. The chips were equally delicious. Freshly fried, not over cooked, just the right amount of salt. The burrito was the main course and it was off the charts. It was shredded beef (not the Carne Asada) and oh-so-amazing. The tortilla was crisp but not hard, warm and not soggy, everything about it was perfect.  If you're looking for the perfect meal, this is the place. Worth the 5 minute drive from downtown. Eat here!!!

jFNZmVIOBRbb2R1Bb7JNmA.text: FIRE  1) bangin marg.   2) dope vibes, decorated very well. i love a nice wood paneling set up. good wood   3) man, that campechano taco is hella flame. it would definitely be a mistake to go through life without eating that wonder. like what would the point be? what are you trying to prove? would it be worth it? no, i don't think it would. order the taco. stop being a knucklehead   4) solid guac. worth it  5) i really enjoyed how the salsa for the chips came in a squeeze bottle. bc, ya know, i am a glutton. So, i really appreciate how i can just lazily squirt a bunch on my chip. my wrists are too delicate to constantly hoist the odious burden of dipping a chip. also, that green salsa is bing bang boom yum nom yum in the tum tum pow pow pow  yummy yummy ya hoooooooo

2EwS-yA5RjE5SWgqUgwn5g.text: I was headed over to the new Welcome Diner for lunch today but they don't open until 5 PM.  I had also wanted to try out the new Gallo Blanco so I went across the street.  The building is a former grocery store that's been remodeled and I headed to the right from the entrance door to the bar that you really can't see when you first walk in to the the restaurant.  It was a little odd to see an old Anthony Bourdain show playing on one of the TVs given what had just transpired.  I'm gonna miss Tony and his take on travel and food.  Gallo Blanco is a place that he would have liked.  They have a full bar, wine, and some pretty good craft beer selections on tap.  I had the La Bomba torta to eat which was fantastic.  Large, meaty, cheesy and a great bun.  The chips were an extra $2 and came with squeeze bottles of red and green salsa.  I enjoyed my lunch and will be back to this corner of the Garfield district in the near future.

UZto491dQVICFzky_McIMA.text: Gallo Blanco is so good! I've been here twice and the food has been stellar both times. It is located in a gentrifying area of downtown Phoenix across form the Welcome Diner. The atmosphere is loud enough so you can have a private conversation without others hearing, but not too loud that you can't hear yourself think.   I ordered the carne asada tacos and churros for dessert. The chef must have been a lifelong resident of flavor town because they were both out of this world! Had a sample of the horchata afterwards which was also really tasty. I highly recommend this place for good quality Mexican food.

pVq0BpgZMI_paku9Dbhwpw.text: We spent the first happy hour of 2019 sipping on craft cocktails while snacking on perfect chips and salsa. I love the hipster vibe of this place and the food that went along with it. Everything we ordered was good but there were some stand out menu items that deserve an honorable mention. The fries and aji aoili was spicy and flavorful. The chips excelled in crunchiness, thickness and saltiness. The elote was cooked and seasoned well. The tacos were seasoned nicely and bigger than expected. The churros were on par with Mexico City churros!! They were crunchy on the outside and the dough had a great taste. The dipping sauces complimented the churros very well. The favorite beverage at the table was the picosso. The sweetness was there but not overwhelming and the balancing act between the sweet and spicy elements played nicely off each other.

r_rG1DCt7esYiUDx1xCJ1w.text: Yup. This place is damn good. Great drinks. Greay food. Great service. In fact, it was all so good that we went two days in a row. _OpmdGDbrMluHVePa9lbAA.text: I totally like what they have done with this newer Gallo Blanco but I sure do miss the old one. I see that the menu is a little different from the first time I went there and it had some more of their old entrees that I loved, helllloooo carne asada burrito. However, I am totally judgy when it comes to chips and salsa and it is directly linked to how good I think a Mexican restaurant is. I miss the old fire smoked salsa they had. The salsa they have now is hot hot hot, watery, and in condiment bottles, ehhh. Food is still good but I want the whole experience when going out to a Mexican food restaurant, with the market being over saturated with them I have plenty of choices and can go somewhere that has it all.

Food 4 out of 5  Service 3 out of 5  Ambience 4 out of 5
