DlbB6zQffcx97Zth1G2eTw.text: Loved the old Gallo, but sadly this place just doesn't live up. Service on a Sunday night was a mess. Stood at the entrance for 5 minutes before anyone acknowledged us, and was told good luck if you can find a table in the bar.  No prob, found a table for our party of 6 that some guests were just leaving. We stacked their dirty plates and sat, and sat, and sat.   10 minutes later I started to approach the bar and was told, someone would be over shortly. 10 minutes after that, a we received water and menus and were told a server would be over to take our orders. As promised, someone did eventually come and take our orders. We had been there long enough at this point to know that we were only going to get one shot, so quickly placed all our drink, appetizer, and food orders at once. 40 minutes after arriving half our drink orders arrived. 10 minutes after that, the last 3 drinks and then finally food.   Those dirty dishes and glasses that were on our table when we arrived? Were there the entire time. And we weren't alone, but the time we left all the bar area tables were covered with dirty plates and empty glasses- ick. Clearly one server and one bartender were just not enough to keep up with the crowds.   Food was OK, but with so many other great Mexican restaurants in town with great food and way better service, will take my biz elsewhere.

But a few months ago, I came in an ordered a margarita (already a favorite), and what I got was even more wonderful than anticipated.  Thanks to the new bartender Andy, the already great Margarita gets an extra strong shake and the result is something between a Margarita on the rocks and a slushy. CMOQ_-WjcpFiKOvyRfhXgA.text: Living in California, I am spoiled with amazing Mexican food.  I rarely have the need for Mexican food when I'm traveling (unless I'm in Mexico, obviously, ha!), so when some friends suggested we eat at Gallo Blanco, we were fine with the suggestion but knew Californian Mexican food would surely beat this Arizonan Mexican variety.  Now I'm not so sure who would win that throw down.   The atmosphere of the restaurant was lively without going too far into a bar feel.  No chips are automatically brought to the table, which is probably the smart way to go,  but something I like when eating at my usual Mexican spots.  We had a party of seven so ordered a few bowls of chips and guacamole.  The guacamole was really good.  It had some big chunks of avocado, which is so much better than guacamole that is mashed/mixed up into an overly creamy mess.  The food and drinks here are cheaper than in LA.  Not saying much, I suppose, since a pressed juice can start at $10 in Atwater Village, but still.  I'm not a beer girl, but they even had cans of Tecate for $2!  A few in the party had that, and if you're on a budget, it's nice to have $2 beers!  My boyfriend had the Dragoon IPA, which he enjoyed and at only $7, it was a good deal.    There was a lot of food ordered, but some standouts for me and my group:  * chicharron de queso - this was amazing!  I may dream of it tonight.  A HUGE fried chichuahua and manchego cheese crisp, served with an aji aioli dipping sauce.  (Is recommend ordering this early on, sharing it, and adding bits of it to any salads or sides).   * elote callejero - your standard Mexican grilled corn served with the mayo, cotija cheese, chile and smoked paprika.  The servers offer to shave the corn off the don for you, which is nice and helps make sure you don't look like a messy pig within a few bites.  I can't recall if it came with lime wedges or not, but if not...ask for them.  Mexican corn always needs a squeeze of fresh lime juice!  * de la casa salad - romaine, avocado, cherry tomatoes, pepitas, jicama, cucumber, cotija...very fresh and delicious.  Would have been enhanced had I crumbled some of my cheese crisp on there!!  * Tacos - the big hits with our group was the al pastor and the campechano (this is a mix of longaniza, al pastor and carne asada)   I almost want to plan another trip to Phoenix just for the fried cheese.  Is that weird??

eYUYhFi77t3MLqhGsx-t3g.text: The good, the bad, and the ugly... this wasn't our first experience, but previously only ate at the old Clarendon location.   The good (sort of):  the food is slightly above average Mexican. Good overall. I enjoyed everything we ate (once we finally got it).   The bad: the service!  The bar was insanely slow in making drinks. Our waiter, who overall seemed indifferent and wasn't great, even felt the need to apologize for the drink delays. It was a Saturday night but not insanely busy. The waiter didn't come by very often and was a stereotypical hipster type who seemed indifferent and annoyed that he was there to serve the table. The food runner brought half of our table's food and asked "anything else I can bring?"  Yup. The rest of the table's food. The service was incredibly awkward overall. The waiter would correct us at every chance. We would ask for an option in english and he would condescendingly reply back with the menu option... not in a clarifying manner but in a superior-than-thou response.   The ugly: the bathroom. It was 7:30pm on a Saturday night but not insanely busy. The bathroom was gross. Filthy corner, overflowing trash can, gross bathroom fan. If they can't keep the bathroom clean that early in the evening, then what's the kitchen like?  Overall, underwhelming. The wait staff seemed annoyed with every interaction (when you could finally get them to come around). Service slow and awkward. I wouldn't come back.

NnAGgUjezUmmIIg6lgRWrA.text: What a mess! Luckily the food was good but the "system" is jacked! You check in with the hostess who takes your name and number and then you wait to be called. Pretty typical so far. A 20 minute wait turned into 45. Drinks were about $10 a person. We had 2 rounds before they called us. Then you get a table assigned. Then you go to the counter and order, then you sit and wait for your food to come. The problem is that the system is so confusing that a ton of people just came in and sat down because there seemed table open. Then they went up and ordered and get their food way before others. I can see this system working at lunch time but not on a Saturday for dinner.  Also, the tumeric and tamarind drink is a no-go. Don't bother with it - totally not worth it.

oHes7xN1uJxHAnUZgcMGQQ.text: Went here for a date night.  I would recommend sitting in the bar side, it's full service on that side.  The chips and salsa were my favorite part, great chips!  We shared the family platter, which easily made 6 small tacos.  They made me a pineapple mojito that wasn't on the menu and it was delicious!

D-YR6rX5yzf9DEn1C-tNGg.text: Maybe First Friday, and their 2nd Friday of being open wasn't the best time to come. We found parking up the street and around the corner. I was confused on where to enter, once in and after looking around the big square shaped room I found my way to a counter. The cashier/hostess told me there was a 15 minute wait. I gave her my order for 2 Pacifico beers and paid 15.00 she gave me a number card and told me they'd bring my beers to me. There isn't a waiting area so I awkwardly  stood against the wall with a few others, hovering over people eating. My husband made his way to the bar and after a few minutes found one available seat. I get that there are kinks to be worked out, and staffing needs to be amped up especially for busy weekends so I maintained a positive attitude. Watching the 3 bartenders work furiously made our 10 minute wait to be acknowledged, fly by. Our beers were brought to us and all was well. Eventually we had a chance to order and the food was good, pricey but good. Description of food; 1. Carne Asada Tacos were tender, perfectly seasoned, small, good corn tortilla and garnished with raw onion/cilantro/lime wedges. You are given 2 plastic bottles one with a green guacamole salsa and the other is red salsa, both great additions to the tacos. 2. Fried Cheese Tower (chichharon de queso) had good flavor and a fun item for your Instagram photos. 3. Paloma Cocktail had a smokey citrus taste to it. All in all I liked the vibe, although a bit hectic and  different than original Gallo Blanco #1 @the Clarendon this new building has  beautiful  character and is a great revitalization to this downtown community. I look forward to coming back on a relaxed day when the wrinkles are ironed out and updating my review to a higher one.

6uLrsLwFFfG2eoQFv-cPeg.text: Went to Gallo Blanco last night for dinner and I have nothing but great things to say! Our server was very accommodating and was eager to answer any questions we had, the tacos were phenomenal (I recommend their Al Pastor) and we finished the meal with their churros which were heavenly. 10/10 and I can't wait to go back!

RPh7m4QF-Ooz843Dl6Yirw.text: Great food and drinks ... the helote and envuelto were excellent.  But, having the menu written in only Spanish is ridiculously affected (and for the record, I'm a gringo, but I used to live in Mexico and can speak and read the language ... most of the other gringos can't).    Configuration of restaurant is also confusing ... In the front part, you order from a counter, but then get to sit at your own table ... the back part is the bar where you get a waiter and table service, but you have to share a table with strangers.    The neighborhood is getting much better compared to even 5 years ago, although it may freak out some of the PV/Scottsdale crowd.  We walked home in the dark, however, and it was fine.  As I said, the food was super and we will definitely be back.

C-AkFa95e7bsL2OfjFCioQ.text: Mexican food is a tricky nuisance. I've found that it's either authentic and a hole in the wall, or classy and not very authentic. However, Gallo Blanco has managed a clean, modern environment with some of the best authentic Mexican food I've had in a long time with an elevated touch.  I've had a lot of amazing restaurants in my time, so it's truly hard for me to ever pick just one that would be my favorite. However, I think this could be it...  Incredible drinks, quality and well crafted. Super delicious and unique twists on classics!  All of the tacos were really, really good, each for their own reason!  The star of the show is their churros... by far the best churros in the valley!! I would come back just for the churros!!

K0E0f-l0gn-RlASDyfmTmw.text: I had to update my review cause this place stepped up their game. The food is as good as always but the service is locked into light speed! Killing it! Even if you're the only person in there, and the bar is over staffed... you are going to wait. This place gets 5 stars for food but one 1 star for service. I wish they would fix that because the envuelto, the guacamole, the ceviche, the churros... oh the churros... , the cocktails, ALL are so good. But you're gonna be pissed off at the slow service i every time.

03YUwFOeWus8txix_3HllQ.text: I loved Gallo Blanco! I came in for lunch but I had skipped my morning coffee (huge mistake, why did I do this??). Luckily, Gallo Blanco, has a expresso bar. As far as food, we ordered the guacamole, the envuelto (omg amazing al pastor folded inside of cheese!), and a couple of tacos (carne asada and barbacoa). I also got a margarita. Everything was flavorful and delicious!

kSXxicpRhJgOr-P59uXs6A.text: My husband and I go here all the time. Great food and drinks, staff is always incredible. The Agua Frescas are fresh and taste amazing.   My only recommendation is to get rid of the straws.   This is a local 5-star restaurant with great staff, services and prices. I recommend this to friends family and coworkers all time.

VYo4nzGErREe8pcWDMPwgQ.text: The facility itself is very aesthetically pleasing.... inside and out. The ambiance inside has a classy Mexican theme.    I ordered the Chilaquiles for breakfast. Maybe I'm too picky but I grew up in the Mexican culture including a lifetime traveling to Latin countries and I've never seen Chilaquiles like this...     The taste was decent.... I stress "decent".  But the consistency and presentation lacked any appeal. Look at the pics!    I'm just traveling through but was looking forward to huevos rancheros or Chilaquiles... very disappointed to say the least.    On the bright side. Other items on the menu looked great (judging from other people's plates). The service was commendable and the employees were very pleasant.    I'll be back though...they seem to really want to make their guests happy and service is BIG in my book.

KzAbhWYLFIKcR5lYanm6LQ.text: Came here with a group of friends! We were very much disappointed with the service. We came at 5pm which was in the middle of happy hour. Within that one hour we were only able to get one cocktail because our waitress was no where to be found. She didn't even stop at our table to see if we wanted one more round before happy hour was over. When I finally got her at 6:02pm (happy hour ends at 6pm) She said sorry you missed it, happy hour is over. The restaurant wasn't even packed last night. The food was great!!! I highly recommend trying the house margarita. It was excellent. I tried the ceviche as my appetizer and the bean and cheese burrito. I was satisfied with both. The green salsa is amazing. Highly recommend though you go else were for better service.

wUSN8J5y40YnnhQqDDbUtw.text: We've been missing out!  We sat at the tall tables near the large windows. We tried the guacamole, salsa trio, and chips with Gallo margaritas. A great start!  Then we had elote, cut at the table, and the Taco Dorado. Holy crap these were amazing! More chips to finish off the guacamole...which has a nice surprise in it.  We ordered the tres leches to finish off our meal, but they were out, so we tried the churros. The churros were also amazing! I'm not normally a huge fan of caramel, but this goat's milk caramel is not overly sweet, which is super yummy! They also came with sweetened condensed milk and chocolate sauce for dipping.  There is so much more on the menu to try, so we will definitely be back!

_71vlfwyq0EeZCk_B05FWA.text: The tacos were excellent. The horchata with the sprinkled canela was wonderful. Service was great. I want to focus on the corn tortillas, as these were the best corn tortillas I've ever had on either side of the border. This was obviously not a tortilla made from the store Maseca we see at every other taqueria. The yellow corn tortilla was pliable, moist, flavorful, and smooth.   Good job on doing a wonderful taco and not neglecting the tortilla.

dm1RvONkaH21g_2-CmESLw.text: Service 4/5 Food 4/5 Ambiance 4/5  Came here for brunch on a Sunday. No excessive lines or waits which was nice. We were able to seat ourselves wherever. The inside has a nice modern Mexican vibe to it. The staff were very friendly. I ordered the biscuits and gravy which had a nice spin on the classic recipe adding more Mexican spices giving it a nice flavor. The biscuits were a little over cooked and slightly crunchy for my taste. It comes with two eggs which was nice. I added a side of bacon. I will be back to try some of the other options. The breakfast burrito was very popular amongst my table.

2p4j108gzGMg5AsxfVWwYA.text: Been here twice in the past two weeks which says a lot. Actually, the first time, they had run out of the Pollo del Dia which is the house specialty so we came back again. Overall, this place has upscale mexican cuisine at reasonable prices. The guacamole, chips and salsa are excellent and I had to get a container of red salsa to go because I liked it so much. The roast chicken is everything I've come to expect from south of the border cuisine and the meats in the tacos and tortas are definitely premium cuts. Added to my list of regular spots especially at happy hour.

YQMjLANMsfTtDpJst2Hb9Q.text: Some twisted gentrification happening here -- menu is all Spanish but all customers were lol-trendy folk and everyone in line was asking what things meant. V laughable place

fJgst8_Q2acIUg__ZqWKKQ.text: OMG you guys. This place did NOT disappoint. We stopped by a little late on a Thursday night and I got the pork of the day torta. Truly amazing. Highly highly recommend!

oIhzqjfDbLQT00uWmnjIBQ.text: Carne asada was really good. The fries are super good as well. My stomach was so filled with these two food that costed $14. The server service wasnt that good as it was near closing around 10:10 pm but the food was delicious!

6rkDkrrUKzzOZ6KvKOnXrA.text: Very delicious refine Mexican food at very reasonable prices.  Highly recommend the breakfast dish "chilaquiles"that is served all day long with 3 layers of crispy tortilla with chicken in a chimichurri sauce.  The mole chicken and tres leches are both excellent as well

MYVMWE8L1-dqKBMybfJoQw.text: Gourmet food; delicious. Great customer service. Very clean. A little on the expensive side.

bC0KWRe4vYncZmDSGtLC6Q.text: kelly makes the best margaritas, i like it with the chili rim instead of salt !! also the ceviche is a must.

XZgslgzJUIFeyJBUGMRTrg.text: Amazing food! Love this place  only downside is once you're done there really isn't any place to go to next. Surrounding streets seem sketch

Oo6PHGdMa_YJPjugfNtB1g.text: This is my second time visiting this restaurant, and I must say that I admire the consistency. The carne asada was marinated and grilled to perfection and their campechano tacos tasted authentic which is something that I've been looking for in the Phoenix valley. Along with the consistency of their food, this place has a list of artisan tequilas, mezcals, and other Mexican spirits. I highly recommend grabbing a seat at the bar and asking one of the knowledgeable bartenders to give you an exploratory adventure through their premium agave spirits. If you are a connoisseur of craft spirits, you will not be disappointed.   The price point of the tacos here represents the quality of their products as well as the phenomenal preparation. This is not the place to go if you are looking for a quick cheap taco that costs less than 2 dollars. These tacos are 3.50 each, or you can get a family style dish served on a hot plate with a side of 6 corn tortillas. I recommend the second option, because you are going to want to order more as soon as you put down the first round of tacos. The preparation time for these tacos take time, so patience is essential, but as I keep saying it will be worth every minute and penny.  The ambiance of this place is what you would expect for a hip upscale taco shop nestled in the Roosevelt community. It looks like it's a historical building that was completely gutted and renovated with a fresh wood interior. The open ceiling and floor to ceiling windows produces a warm community-like environment that makes you want to walk around to other tables and make friends. The bar is neatly organized and creates an eye-catching display of all the artisan spirits available for tasting. The exterior of the building adds to the ambiance by remaining to keep its vintage look.   The service is exceptional. Both times I have visited I have sat at the bar. The first time I enjoyed a great mescal that was recommended. (I forget the name, but will be back to get it again.) My girlfriend got a margarita that was balanced to perfection. To eat, I first tried the carne asada tacos and immediately fell in love. I ordered a second round of carne asada and also sampled the campechano which I fell in love with as well. My girlfriend tried the Naco Torta and was more than satisfied. Naco Torta consisted of fresh, ripe avocado, tender carne asada marinated to perfection, an over medium egg, and greens all on a toasted artisan bun. After all of this food, I couldn't help but order the churros with 3 different dipping sauces. The churros were crispy on the outside with a warm fluffy, but dense inside. I personally enjoyed the chocolate dipping sauce, but it also came with a leche, and caramel sauce.  Overall I highly recommend this place to anyone in the Phoenix community. I will now be a loyal customer to this reastaurant because of the quality and consistency of the food, service and of course tequila.

0-sxFLvAsBWS2lEqc1k6aQ.text: Really just not good. I wanted so bad to love the new location, the old spot was my all time favorite phx joint... however so much to be desired at the new location. After seated, waited a good 5 minutes to get water from our hostess on a pretty slow Sunday afternoon. We ended up waiting a total of 25 mins before our server finally showed up and simply says "you want some food?" It's like "naw, we just thought you had nice tables and wanted to check them out!" Margaritas were too sweet and weak. My girl got a veggie burrito that ended up coming out filled with almost 40% with cheese and oil, chips and quac app is almost a single serving size IMO. I got the half chicken and it was really good, but took another 25-30 minutes to get after ordering. None of this would have been that major if it weren't for the lack of effort on the servers side who showed up at our table maybe 3 times tops the whole night, and even seemed like she was chewing food when approached us one time? I'm not usually one to leave bad reviews, but Gallo used to be my #1. I loved the food and atmosphere at the Clarendon, but i was seriously disappointed by the experience and probably wouldn't risk bringing friends here a second time.

vzM5YdxzuN63iL_soe-hnw.text: Fun environment and delicious food!  Gallo Blanco is a great lunch spot for when you just want to chill for a bit.  I've heard it's a favorite spot for (a rather late) breakfast as well.

yLs38-AIyPuwG77umG2uDw.text: We stopped in last weekend for drinks and a snack.  I ordered a jamaica cocktail and loved it and we shared the family style tacos with carne asada and al pastor...tasty tortillas and fillings.  Great atmosphere, great music, good service, great drinks and good food...excited to see this restaurant join the neighborhood!

c_3GWJH3CVia0h7sGBwwHQ.text: Loved the old location and liking the new location. Not entirely inspired by the new location because it's so hidden. Went for lunch and it seemed a bit wonky even though it wasn't too packed. Have high hopes for this place, I hope it can do well!

ApqBLn1LNNEbvHZM5JB6pw.text: I stopped into this place not knowing what to expect. The guacamole was delicious with chucks of pineapple. So good! I had the carne asada tacos. They were a good size and priced reasonably. I ordered three but was good with just two. I loved the Mexican "aguas"

0EYRs2i8HV5F0e1w_E6skg.text: It was a little too pricey $ although the food was great and very casual I would definitely come back and try some more food.

x1_WiXvCu3mUB8CmJorQJw.text: Not the same - AT ALL.  First, let me say I am a huge Gallo Blanco fan. We were easily there weekly at the Clarendon location. Second, I can't rate the food because we couldn't get that far. The venue gives NO consideration to acoustics so it is impossible to hear the staff, or your dining companion. As if this isn't bad enough the stereo system was on so loud the speakers were crackling. Other customers are yelling just to have conversation making the the atmosphere unnerving. As we stood in the slow moving line to order we contemplated the all Spanish, one word per item wall menu. Thinking the paper menu would lend some descriptions, explanations, hints or clues, about the food, we grabbed one only to find the same brief one word items. Focusing on those in front of us, we quickly realized the staff was spending time explaining the menu slowing the ordering process to a halt. We waited a few more minutes and moved on. I didn't anticipate having to run some sort of loyalty gauntlet to continue patronizing a restaurant that at one time actually considered the customer experience. Not sure what they might be thinking with this business model, but they should revisit the topic.

p1Cn1TJgXhoV3S9zH3f2fQ.text: I came in the other night for some tacos a few appetizers and a beer. All the food was delicious but the rice came out cold.  I asked the server about it and she said she would heat it up. It came out yet again, cold. I was confused... I asked the server about it and she walked away rudely saying she'll get it taken off the bill without trying to correct anything. Some lady in charge walked over and said that's how it's prepared. If the server would of said that from the beginning it would of made sense but she apparently didn't know the menu. NOW, back to the lady in charge... I wasn't even upset.. the rice was still good just cold... I let her know the situation and all she could say is " well...that's why I'm over here now to let you know" it was all with attitude. Great food doesn't taste very well with terrible service.

GWmk82ptQfSrZ4PB83ge8w.text: Love everything here! Tacos are great, the churros are also a must! Husband got the chicken, he loved it and had leftovers. Great service too!

6ajJq-ih_Ml4tD7pkcHZ8A.text: Food was good. Not incredible I need to eat here again, but decent. Prices was not crazy high, but not cheap. Service however was horrible. The waitress was actually pretty nice but the overall vibe of the restaurant was chaos. No one greeting people a free for all of where to sit and who will wait on you. Again, decent place that I won't be going out of my way to eat at again.

Qd2V3VwXOjgouD0C-5JrCg.text: We went here for dinner tonight and we were majorly disappointed. We had been looking forward to the new Gallo Blanco for so long as we were major fans of the original one! I like that they have found a cool place in the Garfield neighborhood - it's nice and quiet, plenty of area to park in, although I think if I lived in the area I might not be as happy with the extra traffic. Foot traffic was light we were able to order right away, but the menu on the big board leaves much to be desired. And it took a while to figure out what was there. I will say I was disappointed to not see Queso Fundido on there! Hubby had a michelada, which tasted like tomato juice with a splash of beer. They were nice enough to bring him extra beer free of charge. Without the queso fundido available, we tried the Envuelto. It was okay. For the amount that you got, the $12 seemed a little overpriced for the location and set up. We followed it up with the Naco torta, which used to be my favorite thing at the original. I was wanting it to have so much more flavor! :( There was nothing Mexican about it, except for the fact that it was named a torta.  Overall, we were happy with the service, but it felt weird to leave a tip when ordering our meal at the beginning given that you order at the counter. And it's the reason for the 3 stars. The service throughout our meal was great though. The food though left so much to be desired and we left majorly disappointed. Most of the flavor seemed to come from the grease/oil and not from seasoning/spices. There actually seemed to be minimal seasoning throughout.  We'll probably be sticking with Otro Cafe, although I for sure miss the Original Gallo Blanco.

sqPvzTjcmHeCZZ-LPd5dLQ.text: Didn't even realize this spot was so close to home and so glad i found it! Had a late lunch here Saturday afternoon and it was so delicious. Tacos were excellent--del mar, asada, you can tell they use good quality ingredients and the flavors are all on point. Their house made salsas are amazing. My friend ordered the chilaquiles and said that was very good as well. Lots of vegetarian options. Don't forget the churros! Pretty big helping, great for sharing and a fine way to end the meal. Will be back for sure--would love to check out happy hour specials.

-RvVL3GO-Tr1k_MhllJjRA.text: So effin satisfying. Living in AZ, one definitely gets a wide array of pretty crappy slash cheap slash good enough for the money Mexican food.. these guys do it right.   Fish tacos.. fish burrito.. guacamole and salsa with chips.. all very bueno, nothing was not bomb! And our tab was fast less than we thought for how good it was.  Definitely gotta check it out

o3OjK0AGf2dHxWLlxJNjqA.text: I'll start with the pros the restaurant itself is really nice and the music is perfect. The service is really nice and friendly too! I had already ate prior to coming in but I randomly spotted this place and wanted to give it a try so I started small and just got the corn on the cob and the churro. The corn was really tasty as for the churro the presentation is nice and the dipping sauces are super clever but it was really soft inside like uncooked I couldn't even take more than two bites. I was really disappointed but I would totally still come again to try the actual food and their drinks!

AVwPzxnHMhUw2ZQRArw2qA.text: Came at happy hour. $5 delicious margaritas.  Warm chips and fresh guacamole.  We had the tacos: battered fish, vegetable, and carne asada tacos.  All were delicious. And excellent hot sauce on the table (green and red). Saw some delicious looking soup being served...will try next time.

NkLu41JJTC5Xv3lgZHR8yw.text: Tasty. The guacamole was pretty good. The shrimp tacos were good but needed a pinch more of something. Would liked to have seen a couple more fish/seafood options. Nice atmosphere. Professional staff. Worth a visit. Location is off the beaten path.

SQTeGaP813uyz7dBFreJGQ.text: This place is trendy, and has amazing food! There was 3 if us in our party and we ordered the La Parillada ($17) with Barbacoa, and Carne Asada, 2 sides of Arroz Verde ($3), and an order of chips and Guacamole ($6). This was more than enough food for the three of us, and we took some home for later. The meats are tender and flavorful, tortillas are fresh, and salsas are incredible. The staff is friendly, and knowledgeable about the items on the menu, and just fun to interact with. I have nothing critical to say about Gallo Blanco, except you're crazy if you don't give it a try!

XfOS-A89jvcunBYqTl4wDg.text: I haven't tried everything on the menu but anything I have tried it's delicious. It's autentica comida mexicana 100 % recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

k5G5vJPY8-H7GbDXvqrZFg.text: Oh Gallo, how I missed you so during your hiatus. Please never leave me again. Everything at Gallo is great and their tortillas are the bomb! Plenty of gluten-free options, great drinks and OMG the guacamole. Top 3 Mexican joint in Phoenix, easy. Imma keep it short and sweet - this place rocks ya'll.

W7T7pHgtQ88TZEuqLzHbFQ.text: First time at Gallo Blanco.  My spouse had heard of this place before so we gave it a try.  The decor and ambiance is great.  Parking can be quite a challenge.  It was a busy Saturday afternoon and were seated quickly, but had no server acknowledge us fo about 7mins. The chips and salsas were delicious, the chips are the real deal, none of those thin Chili's type of chips.  I am very particular about my guacamole and I must say it was very good. My spouse ordered a torta and he loved it.  Now my order on the other hand fell flat.  Being hispanic I always find a sense of happiness when I see chilaquiles on the menu.  I knew exactly what i wanted as soon as I locked eyes on the chicken chilaquiles.  When my dish arrived i was dumb founded and thought "ok i think there was a mix up, i did not order a tostadas!" The chilaquiles came in a layer of 3 tostadas with cheese chicken and a green salsa.  Besides finding it difficult to cut it up and eat it, the flavors were just not what you would think they would be when thinking if chilaquiles. Im giving this place a 4 star because even though i did not like my dish i know other things on the menu will probably be good. At the distance I saw other great dishes so i will be back to try something new like the pozole and the mexican corn most definitely.

Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious salsas and guacamole! Chips are the real deal
Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. NOT you typical chilaquiles.

MkA-HKHiXCfZqRlKj4HWaw.text: We started out with the chips and guacamole, wish there had been more of it because it was delicious and I hadn't eaten all day so I was famished. Luckily the food came out shortly. I had carne asada, al pastor, and barbacoa tacos and they were delicious- as always. So glad I found Gallo Blanco again, I missed it so much after it had left the Clarendon.

oiPJkM01zhntk5kvEb84cQ.text: Great food and service. We always go back for the pozole rojo and the al pastor tacos. Their margaritas were very good ask well. Will go back!

k-rGdrDrVfqo7UByQNm9-w.text: The food is really good and authentic Mexican / urban style. I recommend the Naco torta and the elote. Their pozole is really good if you are a person who likes soups.   If you went to the old location of Gallo Blanco, you must try the new location. Their food is soo much better:)

pcQ4IFoNMbXxzp-u2PFCqg.text: Wonderful chiliquillos! Friendly, fun place. Order beer with chiliquillos, though...too spicy for wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yCMv-DpeTzr_9qmbDpluDw.text: 4 stars for the excellent taco Tuesday special that runs ALL DAY! Which means I don't have to panic after leaving work to get anywhere before 6. That in itself is HUGE. My mimosa was delicious as well as my tacos, however, I was disappointed that they drastically changed their menu with the relaunch of Gallo Blanco. I prefer Otro Cafe now which is closer to what Gallo Blanco used to be although Gallo has a better happy hour.

Uu8cx5Nbnttm5P7dDePbyA.text: Worst service ever! My boyfriends food was served 20 minutes before my food, once the waitress realized she had to put in order again and had to wait another 10 minutes, while my boyfriends food got cold. The waitress said they had served it to the wrong table. I'm so disappointed I was looking forward to this restaurant. The waitress was so nonchalant about the whole situation!!

7J7DMesUfmBw36bXKOaQMg.text: OMG ALL I CAN SAY IS "FOOD COMA"!!! Came here by accident because the place we were planning to go eat had a 2 hour wait and cash only. Googled a spot and Gallo Blanco came up.   Well, we are so glad it did and that we came! My family and I loved this place! THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS!!! That Naco Torta, elote callejero and churros WERE BOMB...and that was just my order, lol.  WE WILL BE COMING BACK FOR SURE!!!! GREAT WAY TO CELEBRATE MY BIRTHDAY!

gl_904247fksu7Eb388Z1Q.text: Great Mexican joint in downtown Phoenix. Food was amazing and flavorful! Good service and great atmosphere. Decent portions and price was fair. Can't wait to come back and try more dishes and cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BpddIW13_6ykJtB-mkeUXA.text: First, the atmosphere and the people are great. My review is mostly about the food we tried. we ordered a pastor burrito, torta asada, and the ceviche pescado. 1st the burrito was OK. it had a nice taste but was rather small for the price. it could have used some more ingredients for more taste. 2nd all the same goes for the asada torta. The ceviche was delicious but the portion was way to small for $15. I saw more plate than ceviche and i finished it pretty quickly. the homemade chips & salsas are very deliscios

fDCu1Dv_64QhG3fbliAmwA.text: I will start with the good.  The carnitas taco was amazing.  Nicely seared chunks with excellent seasoning.  Just spectacular.  The salsas were also delicious.  Perfectly balanced and fresh.    We ordered la charola, pastor and carnitas tacos, side of beans, an agua fresca, and michelada.  The beans were good.  The pastor was okay.  The michelada was not up to par and the agua fresca was decent.  For everything it was about 40 bucks with a tip.  I really don't feel it is worth it.  3.25 for a 4 bite taco is just crazy.  I am a taco connoisseur.  I make them weekly and have had them all over the southwest.  As good as the carnitas were, 3.25 for one small taco just doesn't fly for me.  Also 9 bucks for a tiny thing of guac and 3 very small salsas and a small bowl of chiops doesn't make sense to me either.  The beer selection for the michelada was so non-existent the counter clerk didn't even ask.    Also, if you are going to order at the counter and seat yourself the prices should be on par.  I think that may have been the biggest issue.  It's pay at the counter and seat yourself but they are charging full on restaurant prices and then asking for tips.  I guess none of it made any sense to me.    I used to love the old Gallo Blanco and was very excited they reopened so as painful as this is to write if I am keeping it real this new concept just ain't for me.

Hdd1pevE6K0C0zwtYypOaA.text: Good fresh ingredients...but not my style of Mexican. They have taken authentic Mexican food and changed it up!

9nJjDHw5XezdEHdR9K-X_w.text: Watch out for the bartender that can get you a beer, but can't get your order correct. He sounds fluent in some sort of Latin dialect, but may not be. Be prepared for your order to be lost in translation, and your check to be incorrect. Also, don't expect him to write anything down or get it right the third time...#youvebeenwarned

sgeM8nFoIVwR_ISIDp1diA.text: I feel like I'm giving a lot of five star reviews lately but I guess I'm just picking the right places. Looking for a place to get a quick bite to eat I yelped top rated local restaurants and Gallo Blanco came up. I really didn't know what to expect but the ambience was nice. I took a seat at the bar and Andy introduced himself and the rest is history. His food suggestions were amazing. The local craft beer paired perfectly...and the grilled corn...let me just say if I lived in Phoenix I would have it three times a week. Do yourself a favor if you're looking for a great place to have lunch or dinner in Phoenix don't walk, don't run... get in your car and haul ass to Gallo Blanco's

CurDiqwob_Qy-ijoW6EAkg.text: Egh. I guess i am biased. I was in love with the old location and old menu. I will accept the new location which is nestled in a neighborhood and must drive the residents crazy as there is virtually no parking. I will not accept the new menu unfortunately. My husband was in love with the torta flaca. They now have a new version which is just a torta and missing some of the key elements. I ordered the breakfast sampler which is a standard 2 eggs, flapjack, and bacon situation. Nothing to write home about. Our order was slow and no refills from waiter on our water. We had to chase him down to even get the check. All in all not worth the extra drive.

gnQXe3bn-92SJmn2vUiLNw.text: Service lagged a little, but the waitress took care of our dessert . Everything is made in-house, chips are great, Paloma had a very nice layered flavor. The music is fun and not loud like some places. Churros were great!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallo Blanco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-2iGOol6OLp_urhDt3mQcw.text: Gallo Blanco's vegetarian pozole was everything I never knew I needed. The vibe was great, the service was awesome and it is worth the 40 minute drive into Phoenix.

Oh4aNC-HnwTmyt5SqL2obg.text: There's nothing but good things I had to say about the previous Gallo Blanco, and the same goes for the new one!   The staff, the food, art, music, and drinks were all perfect. For being the opening night, we were seated fairly quickly and the wait staff was on top of everything.   We started with the famous guacamole that I've missed so much. Chips were warm and there was even a really good salsa on the side of the guacamole. Pacifico and Negra Modelo on tap, what more can you ask for?   Got the half pollo and the tortillas were delicious! Also had an al pastor taco and a campechana (mixture of meats).   It's a great location with great music. It was a good vibe to see everyone enjoying their food and signing along to the music. Can't wait to go back!

Jb0qPmExgUZVl15qY39jGA.text: As I sit here for 20+ minutes while our server runs around the dining room looking aimless, finally someone comes to us from the bar area wearing a Greg Norman golf shirt and asks what we're waiting on and offers to take care of the drinks for us.  We'll see when (if) food shows up-10 minutes later, still no food we ordered apps and entrees...well food took 15 minutes after drinks... guacamole is VERY salty (and I'm not afraid of salt) the taco meat was very burnt... had to request salsa (see picture of dirty bottles and silverware, the family style tacos came with a knife as a serving utensil.  Best things are the Chelada, wine, and chicharon de queso and green salsa...service was beyond lacking because as she said, "when it rains it pours". Oh and it's not even 7 pm and they're out of all desserts???

QpGdWK0rC-ZDyZpkZJs8TA.text: Love this place. Wish it were closer to my house. Everything is good and fresh!  They have healthy lean options!  One of the best restaurants in town!  You can't go wrong here!

P4GCQFF4QZ5Pc__3YSSX_A.text: I love and adore Gallo Blanco! I always order the same thing: Chicken and Marinated Beef tacos with Chips and Salsa. If it's a day off from Marathon Training, I will always enjoy a glass of Sangria. You can't go wrong here. Give 'em a try! Cheers***

5GVo556_B35L-XF6OeGoww.text: Sad day at El Gallo... first time for us at the new location. I was so looking forward to it - I was a die hard fan at the old spot and couldn't WAIT to have a Naco Torta and some of their amazing ceviche and guac again. No one does carne asada like El Gallo Blanco (it's rumored the marinade has Coca Cola in it - the hint of sweetness is fantastic). But we had a deeply regrettable service experience and sadly, they're not doing the ceviche like they used to.   I should preface this by saying that the place was busy - it was lunch time on a Sunday and things were hopping (good to see). But there were a couple empty tables and the frenzied pace of the servers and bartender appeared to be the result of a poor strategy/training more so than truly being slammed.  Put our names in for a table and went to the bar to grab a drink while we waited. Bartender totally ignored us for a good ten minutes! Walked around to another spot to see if it was a visual problem and asked if we could order margaritas - she told us she was "40 drinks back" and refused to take our order! We waited for another 10 minutes and were able to secure seats at the bar when a few patrons vacated... but even THEN she would not take our order. No apologies - she was brusque, exasperated and rude, and busied herself with twelve things at all times, but none of them were seeing to her customers. She spent a lot of time gathering empties, stacking glasses, and replenishing items behind the bar when she could have been communicating, pouring drinks, and making guests feel welcome. She didn't appear to have any interest in the latter.  Finally got a waitress to help us, but she also came off as somewhat resentful that we were asking for food and drinks! It took her another 10 minutes after we spoke to her to come back and take the order, and we had to ask three times for water. (The bartender could have at least tossed a couple of waters down for us!) Our waitress ended up making our drinks herself; the bartender was still too busy cleaning off the counter to bother. Order was placed a good half-hour after we arrived. Unacceptable. And the attitude was worse.  I hope management realizes there's a problem with training and perhaps hiring strategies... this could be a favorite spot but not with these service issues.   Also - bring back the ceviche from the original menu - it was to die for! The new stuff is just OK.

1-NXYpKEAXXKZQSSqs7nKw.text: Holy yum! I wanted to try this place but forgot about it until I drive by and stopped. Let's start with the elote- delicious, and the lovely server cut it off the cob for me. She also helped me order, which having recently given up meat was extremely helpful. The guacamole was awesome! You must get the elote and the guac no matter what else you order! The veggie tacos are so delicious! I think the veggie tacos will tuen me into a regular. Really, really good flavor. There's hope for mw without meat.  Cat is a lovely and friendly employee with great tips on ordering. She also gave me tips to help me since I am trying to give up meat. I will return for sure. And, I may host a happy hour here. Great vibe.

uV1UWbX0-sLEGOLMdIfnGA.text: Omg! The Carne Asada is EVERYTHING! I mean EVERYTHAAANG! So good! Tonight was busy as its Saturday. The bartender forgot to put in our carne order. But the owner came, comped our carne and gave us this corn app which was delish! All in all this was the BEST experience I have had here, and Ive been here a few times! Loves

c6l2G4yJeBmyGTxGTrcvNg.text: Finally got to check out the new location on a Saturday afternoon around 1:30pm. The industrial vibe is no frills, bright, and laid-back. When we arrived, the full-service bar area was pretty packed, but the counter-service side had plenty of open tables and no line.   The service was quick and efficient. The food was incredibly fresh. The music was on point.   I can imagine that the ordering system could possibly get complicated during the rush (in regards to some of the feedback on the other reviews and tips), but all I know is that I had a steaming bowl of vegetarian pozole that was so flavorful it made me want to weep spicy, delicious tears. That in itself will keep me coming back.

rsYl84lGxWTKXsNnWZgLcw.text: I'm not typically a negative reviewer, however I believe the circumstances merit one.  I've been to Otro Cafe and I absolutely love it and I was hoping to have the same experience here.  Unfortunately that was not the case.  The seating is open and I loved the decor and the vibe.  My son and I ordered our drinks and some chips and guacamole to start.  They brought my beer, the chips and guac.  They never brought my sons drink and the server never came back to take our order.  She however did visit every table around us at least twice in the process.  After about 30 min or so I walked up to the register and asked for the check. Clearly my business wasn't appreciated.  The food might have been delicious but the service ruined it for me.

Yza3npFeyepCqakXjp1BkA.text: I had a wonderful time at Gallo Blanco. We went for day drinks and sat at the bar. The restaurant itself is super cute, clean and comfortable. The margaritas were insanely good! The staff was super friendly and attentive. I will definitely be back!

acSL5esGF_O3vxTGDqIaxg.text: This place is so good!! We take the whole family and I get to try everyone's plate. Everything's delicious! Minus the red pork. (Compared to real authentic stuff). The ambience is great, drinks are good. Definitely recommend to try it.

9lzV6wZbiAHRAxMTwY6UhA.text: Love this place, im so happy they brought it back. It's a sketch area but not bad. Love their Al Pastor tacos, the tortillas are the best especially when they are fresh. The guacamole is perfectly seasoned and their salsas are rich in flavor.

YafWBudcv-SHRnyir2TY7w.text: I was not as impressed as my many co-workers. We ordered for 8 for an 11:30am pick up and they let us order early that was nice. I always love it when restaurants can accommodate and do a good job with large orders. They did forget two sides we ordered but no one missed it. I had three tacos: carne asada (good flavored meat), campechano (yummy), and since they have a lot of VG and GF I thought I order a veggie taco (disgusting it was beats and onion). The green and red salsa was good. The guac had pineapple in it, its always weird to me when they do that but I prefer spicy food. We also had the Charron de Queso which just looked like burnt cheese that was odd. I would not go there again, overpriced and flavors not fit for me. If my co workers want it again ill pressure for something different but wont die if we get it. PS: The postres were actually good (coconut pudding; lime tart; tres leches). :)

7hysbA9Sfb8UwHTM_0MnZw.text: After reading recent article in AZ Republic, this sounded like perfect spot to try authentic Mexican food.  Spot on!!  My daughter and son-in-law are visiting from Atlanta.   When they visit we always seek out True Mexican food, so tonight we trekked downtown to find Gallo Blanco. Our expectations, fueled by the article in the Republic, were high.  As we left with delightfully full tummies, we all agreed our expectations had been exceeded.    I had the Huaraches  Campechana as my entree despite it being listed as an appetizer on the menu.  It was absolutely delicious and definitely an adequate portion for an entree for one.   My son-in-law had two tacos; one with carne asada the other the campechana, a mix of carne asada, al pastor and carnitas.  He says they were the best he'd ever had.     My daughter had never had chilaquiles, so she ordered same and absolutely loved it.   She also ordered a side of quac and was stunned at the huge portion.   Also very good.   We finished off the meal by sharing an order of the churros and an order of the plantain pie.  OMG for both!!!   So good.    We sat in the bar where full table service is offered.  We had excellent service with a very knowledgeable server, Kris.    We will be back!!!

pWAQ0ejd5EfDsXq7qUKWlA.text: Wicked good food. Worth the trip to the dodgie barrio. Great value for what you pay, $40 bucks for the three of us. Staff is very friendly and serious customer service. Very clean inside and out. Try it you'll love.
